items.name: Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
items.description:
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/releases

This mod gives you more control over the way weapon groups behave when on autofire. For each weapon group, you can select one or more tags, such as e.g. holding fire when flux > X% or avoiding shields, to customise how that group should behave. Also features basic ship modes (e.g. LowerShields when Flux > 50%) and two ~~badly~~  expertly done GUIs.
Can be added/removed/updated to/from an ongoing campaign.

1.6.0 fixes some minor issues, adds two new tags (Range<N% and ShipTarget) and makes the combat GUI lib usable for mod authors (cf. https://github.com/DesperatePeter/test-combat-gui-lib)

Note for faction/content extension mod authors: Instead of suggested modes/suffixes, you can now list suggested tags for your weapons in modSettings.json. If you had already added weapon modes/suffxies, feel free to leave them in for compatibility  with older versions.  (refer to https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/blob/master/data/config/modSettings.json#L16 for an example). 
For details on how to add tags to enemy ships: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control#assigning-tags-to-enemy-ship-weapons

Please let me know if you encounter any issues or have some feedback!

Thanks in advance and happy gaming/modding!

items.name: Archean Order
items.summary: A complete rebalance of Starsector that focuses on smaller weapons, more fighters and a heavy addition of lore content.
items.description:
This mod adds four additional factions to the game, a couple of dialogue options with dynamic and randomized responses, and a massive amount of new weapons, fighters, ships, alongside a fairly large amount of music as well.

As this is a Total Conversion, other faction/weapon mods will not work well alongside this one. Feature mods are generally fine. See the main post on Starsector's forum mod page for more details.  https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13183.0

Additionally, this mod overhauls the skill system and is incompatible with other mods that attempt to do the same.

items.name: Aria the Escalation - Updated 02-05-21
items.summary: This mod adds the new faction, the Arian Empire, fields a combination massive Expansion Ships - giant, mobile fortresses, escorted by smaller frigates and destroyers. They specialize in deploying masses of mechs and tanks and their weapons revolve around low-tech, short-range ballistic solutions.
items.description:
[center][b]*Important[/b]: Though the mod is tagged as such, it does not actually have extreme violence, gore, swearing or profanity (at least, not by my standards)
This is simply to set the mod as [b]NSFW[/b], and potentially turn away children and the easily offended. Please be at ease and enjoy the mod!

[img]https://i.ibb.co/w6fWvcD/aria-flag.png[/img]
[b][size=6]Aria the Escalation[/size][/b]
[b]*Patch!*[/b] Version 1.0.4 has been released with a fix for Expansion Ships receiving damage from its own modules when losing them!
[b]*New!* [/b]Added incompatibilities section below, thank you to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/starsector/users/5043039]Bret392[/url] for the report!


[youtube]CdmvEE7n-tU[/youtube]

Mod Requirements:
[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=5444.0]LazyLib[/url]
[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=10982.0]GraphicsLib[/url]
[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13718.0]MagicLib[/url]

Integrated with:
[url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=17846.0]Nijigen Extend[/url]
[url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=9175.0]Nexerelin v0.9.5e[/url]
[url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=8181.0]Version Checker V2.0[/url]
[url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=16677.0]Commissioned Crews V1.5[/url]
[url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=16058.0]Vayra's Sector V3.1[/url]

Recommended Mods:
[url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=15939.0]Girls Frontline Portrait Pack[/url]

* [b]Important[/b]: Before updating, always make a save copy just in case!

[img]https://i.ibb.co/S0wQWSJ/aria-update-guide.png[/img][/center]
=============================================================================================================================

[b]I. Summary[/b]:

This mod adds the new faction, [b]Arian Empire[/b] in the Alphard system in the northwest of the core worlds, nearest the Westenesse system. The original idea for this mod is simple: I want to pilot mechs. Thus, the core ships of the Empire consist of massive [b]Expansion Ships[/b] which resemble stations rather than battleships. They are slow and cumbersome, but all of their core modules (which you control) come with the special [b]Panzerkleid[/b] system - which spawns a special mech you control fly around with.

The Empire's tactics revolves around these Expansion Ships. They do have smaller ships in the fleet, but they are all slaved to their home bases, much like their fighters. And speaking of fighters, the faction [b]exclusively[/b] uses mechs and tanks for fighters. The faction's lineup is filled with short-ranged brawlers, built to slug it out with near-peer ships or swarm around larger ones to slow them down enough for the Expansion Ships to get into position and finish the job using immense firepower.

[b]In-Depth Details:[/b]
This roster is made of two types of ship: First is the [b]Expansion Ship[/b], large, armed to the teeth, and equipped with multiple shield generators centered around a *very* fragile core. The ship itself is too slow to get into the thick of battle, so you use its shipsystem to generate your Panzerkleid and join the lighter forces. The second are the [b]Dedicated Combat Craft[/b]. Small, cheap to produce but packs respectable firepower. These will make up your frontline and they come with special mods that make them extremely cheap to run and makes losing one not a big deal.

The ships all come with a base black coat with green undertones and gold trims. I recommend using a more military-themed portrait pack to go with the theme, such as [url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=15939.0]Haze's Girls Frontline Portrait Pack[/url]! Yes, they are all girls too.

The weapon list features cannons and seemingly low-tech gear. Facsimiles of WWII era weapons such as flak cannons and rocket artillery, for the most part. This is juxtaposed by mech infantry armed with bolt-action rifles and hand grenade. And just like their inspirations, the faction works well with slow, grinding warfare.



[center][b]tl;dr:[/b]
- MECHS AND TANKS
- MECHS that you can PILOT.
- Massive station-sized ships, escorted by frigates and destroyers.
- Good at brawling.
- HEAR THOSE ROCKETS FLY
- Built in forge ship! You only need to find the Forge Mods themselves![/center]
=============================================================================================================================

[b]II. Latest Update[/b]:

﻿[size=6][b][center]Latest Minor Patch : 1.0.1[/center][/b][/size][center] 
[list]
[*][b]Applied potential fix to module error without light mode![/b]
[*]Fixed unintentional dependency to YRXP and RYAZ
[*]Fixed unintentional dependency to Nexerelin
[/list][/center]


[center]﻿[size=6][b]Latest Major Update: 1.0.0[/b][/size][/center][center][i]Invasion[/i]
*[b]Important:[/b] This is a [b]major[/b] update and will break saves using previous versions![/center]

[b]A. New features:[/b]

- [b]Light mode[/b]: Poking around and playtesting has suggested there might be an engine-related problem with spawning AI fleets involving ships with modules. That is - every single expansion ship offered by this mod. Due to the fact that this causes a critical error and leads to a crash, I have prepared this workaround for people who wish to play with Arian ships but would prefer not to suffer crashes caused by this problem later in the game.

[i]What does light mode do?[/i]

Simple - it stops the Arian worlds from spawning. It seems you can still start out with an Arian commission (for commissioned crews, for example) using Nexerelin, and there doesn't seem to be a problem caused by this quirk.

For you to obtain Arian ships in a game on Light mode, two new submarkets were added to Nortia and Nova Maxios respectively.

Another benefit to using light mode is that there will be 1 less faction operating in the sector, and less active planets means better performance late game.

That said, you will not be able to access some features such as the new trade goods provided by Aria without the planets, but if you're fine with just playing with Arian ships and weapons then I can fully recommend playing on Light mode.

[i]How do I turn on Light mode?[/i]

1. Go to data\config\settings.json
2. Find the line that says [b]"aria_LightMode":false,[/b]
3. Change it to [b]"aria_LightMode":true,[/b]
4. Save.
5. [b]Start a new game[/b]

[b][!] Important [!][/b] : Light mode takes effect at system generation and will do nothing for an ongoing save! In any case, you shouldn't be adding Aria or updating to v.1.0.0 if you still have an ongoing game!

[b]B. New ships and fighters:[/b]

- New, massive Expansion ships:

[center][Stellar Citadel] [b]Mastein-class Expansion Ship[/b]
[i]by Shellster, esciron (recolored)[/i]

[youtube]0McS0WIgW8k[/youtube]

[youtube]_ioU7f3Xfyo[/youtube][/center]

- The [b]Freikorps[/b], (mostly) midline ship and fighter skins:
[center]

[b]C. New weapons:[/b]
Lots of new weapons, rounding out all types of ballistics weapons from small to large! Here are a few examples:

[center]
[AAA] [b]12.8cm FlaK[/b]

[img]https://i.ibb.co/CtJ2CYh/128-flak.png[/img]

[Siege Cannon] [b]60cm Klara-Gerat[/b]

[img]https://i.ibb.co/BCFZkzC/k-gerat.png[/img]

[Infantry Rocket Launcher] [b]Puppchen[/b]

[img]https://i.ibb.co/thSvs4S/aria-puppchen-turret.png[/img][/center]

[b]D. New hullmods:[/b]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/zx9B2XW/aria-schwarzer-regen.png[/img] [size=6][b]Schwarzer Regen Panzerkleid[/b][/size]
[i]Equips this ship's Panzerkleid System with the Schwarzer Regen Panzerkleid. This heavy assault suit is armed to the teeth with heavy weapons that allows it to take down ships many times its own size.[/i]

(see video above for demo)[/center]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/ZxzkdGY/aria-Retrograde-Armor.png[/img] [size=6][b]Retrograde Package - Armor[/b][/size]
[img]https://i.ibb.co/0QV92N4/aria-Retrograde-Electronics.png[/img] [size=6][b]Retrograde Package - Electronics[/b][/size]
[img]https://i.ibb.co/WyHTB8g/aria-Retrograde-Engines.png[/img] [size=6][b]Retrograde Package - Engines[/b][/size]
[img]https://i.ibb.co/tcR1HpQ/aria-Retrograde-Sensors.png[/img] [size=6][b]Retrograde Package - Sensors[/b][/size]
[img]https://i.ibb.co/ByJqSJH/aria-Retrograde-Turrets.png[/img] [size=6][b]Retrograde Package - Turrets[/b][/size]

These retrograde packages directly reduce the stats of your ship in return for a small amount of OP each.[/center]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/TvP6g8J/aria-Zimmerit.png[/img] [size=6][b]Zimmerit B Coating[/b][/size]
[i]Covers the ship's exterior with energy dissipating paint, reducing incoming energy damage.[/i][/center]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/s3Czvnc/aria-Camo.png[/img] [size=6][b]Klein Coating[/b][/size]
[i]Covers the ship's exterior with a meta-material paint, reducing sensor profile.[/i][/center]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/5FX6JKg/aria-Drive-Field-Stabilizer.png[/img] [size=6][b]Gravitic Leverage Block[/b][/size]
[i]Shapes the curvature of fleet's cumulative space-fold field, increasing the maximum burn of the fleet. The effect of multiple stabilizers is cumulative.[/i][/center]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/FVzm8Qz/aria-RDX.png[/img] [size=6][b]Composition Y[/b][/size]
[i]A new, high-energy propellant used for ballistic munitions which increases their damage, but also increases their flux consumption by the same amount.[/i][/center]

[b]E. New Industries:[/b]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/yVzgMZM/aria-rathaus.png[/img]
[size=6][b]Imperial Rathaus [/b][/size]
[i]The seat of the Arian colonial governor. The existence of the Rathaus establishes the rule of Imperial law across the land; that the strong should not lord over the weak, that the rich should not rob the poor, and that all submit to the rule of the Kaiserin. These tenets are enforced by well-trained police forces - both overt and secret - and as a result, most worlds under Arian rule enjoy a level of stability previously enjoyed only by the well-off and even then, only in particularly rich worlds.[/i]

This is the Arian equivalent of the Yuri Quarter from YRXP.[/center]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/2YgX7HY/aria-rural.png[/img] [size=6]
[b]Rural Preserve[/b][/size]
[i]A region land set aside intentionally for rural residences. Arian settlers are given exclusive ownership of the land, with which they may do whatever they pleased, with the sole exception of heavy industry. In some cases, when establishing these zones in previously heavily industrialized planets, the iron and concrete is broken apart and plant life is allowed to grow in the carcasses of dead cities; and colonization is begun anew.[/i]

Adds a large amount of natural population growth in exchange for a full Industry slot. Very high upkeep. Upgrades to a [b]Lebensraum[/b][/center]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/FnzVKRJ/aria-lebensraum.png[/img] [size=6]
[b]Lebensraum[/b][/size]
[i]Rural preserves, once populated and developed into villages and small towns, grow into fully-fledged Lebensraum, near-ideal homes in the frontier. Forests and artificial lakes would have been carved into planets that lacked them, and the beginnings of wider geoengineering projects have taken their first baby steps.[/i]

Adds a large amount of natural population growth in exchange for a full Industry slot. Beginning to add some natural invome and low amounts of good production. Slightly reduced upkeep upkeep. Upgrades to an [b]Ariascape[/b][/center]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/Qb8JR2f/aria-terrascape.png[/img] [size=6]
[b]Ariascape[/b][/size]
[i]This colony has grown into the spitting-image of the Arian ideal. Large swathes of open country, dotted with rural homesteads, sprinkled with bustling cities here and there. Mountains, whether natural or artificial, promise breathtaking views over an idyllic landscape. Thick forests hosti a number of transplanted animal species imported from Aria itself. They break apart the land in natural, flowing patterns, much like the rivers, within which flows cold, blue water, clean enough for one to take into their hand and drink.[/i]

Adds a large amount of natural population growth in exchange for a full Industry slot. Low upkeep. Adds very high income and a medium amount of commodities.[/center]

[b]F. New Trade Goods:[/b]

[b][!] Important [!][/b] : These are not available when using Light mode!

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/Sf5STcN/aria-baumkuchen.png[/img] [size=6]
[b]Baumkuchen[/b][/size]
[i]A sweet confection made specifically in Baumkuchen, Grunswald. The girls of the Reichsheer absolutely adore it and will often visit retail shops wherver they may find them. Limited exports to arbeiter and freiwillige communities have been also carried out and the response was surprisingly good.[/i][/center]

[center][img]https://i.ibb.co/tCspWF1/aria-model-kits.png[/img] [size=6]
[b]Model Kits[/b][/size]
[i]Plastic model kits of various models of Kampfer suits are a craze among military romantics Arian, Royal Azalean, Yuri and human alike. They are produced in great quantity from beyond the warpgate and shipped here in containers, travelling alongside the Arian settlers who are expected to demand these familiar toys even as they live their new lives here.[/i][/center]

=============================================================================================================================

[b]III. Lore:[/b]

Just like Yuri Expedition, the concept is so far removed from Vanilla that there is no way that this mod is lore friendly. I did, however, add some internal lore regarding each ship and weapon system, because I enjoy that sort of thing. Also, Aria and Caparice share the same lore universe, so there's that.

- So, first things first: How did they get to the sector?
In the early years, around the time of the First AI war, a dimensional crack appeared in the dense, intractable jungles of Keine, of the Alphard System - a middling Persean League member with a Monarchical Polity. The crack originated from the Arian home dimension. For many cycles, clandestine operators roamed the world, blending in with the populace in part due to their natural resemblance to humans, in particular, human girls. They siphoned all information they could - human language, first and foremost, then culture, economy, technology, and military strength. All of this was in preparation for a much-awaited expansion into 'Dimension Drei' - the endless Lebensraum.

=============================================================================================================================


[b]IV. Known Issues:[/b]

- The Panzerkleid system might be a bit iffy if you set your flagship to autopilot (since the script checks for the ship you are piloting) - I hope to improve this in the future

=============================================================================================================================
[b]
V. Incompatibilities:[/b]

- [b]High Tech Expansion[/b] bricks when activated alongside Aria. *[b]UPDATE: [/b]Please check Posts section for a fix to the crashcode posted by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/starsector/users/43574787]HighOnMemes[/url]!

=============================================================================================================================
[b]VI. Still to come:[/b]

- More story missions fleshing out the lore

=============================================================================================================================

[b]VII. Special Thanks:[/b]

This mod was made possible only by the generosity of the community spriters who made their works available within the Kitbash Database and the Free Community Sprite Resources. It wouldn't have done for a faction made entirely out of (not)gundams! That would have been dull (and a big pain)!

Shellster - a particularly big thanks for his nice and boxy shipset in Spiral Arms II. Just what I was looking for!

Agreion - many thanks for providing the market and encounter BGM! It's really great!

Mechs are heavily edited sprites from Mobile Suit Gundam: Cross Dimension. Actually, some are so heavily edited, I might as well have made them from scratch...  :'(

And finally, [b]you[/b]. Thank you for trying out ARIA. I hope you enjoy it!

items.name: Arkships
items.summary:
This mod adds "Arkships" in to the Sector. Arkships are custom Stations that by using an Ability can be moved to any Starsystem.
They do not participate in the economy and you can’t build Industries on them, but you can activate and deactivate Compartments which enable Features as you do so.
items.description:
This mod adds "Arkships" in to the Sector. Arkships are custom Stations that by using an Ability can be moved to any Starsystem.
They do not participate in the economy and you can’t build Industries on them, but you can activate and deactivate Compartments which enable Features as you do so.
The Core Component is the Arkship-Storage, allowing you to move an entire Stations Inventory through the sector.
More details can be found on the Forum post.

**Changelog** :

-> Fixed a bug that due to an oversight wiped the arkships inventory when the player hovered over the storage industries icon in the colony tab
--> The update also removes the compartments industries, the compartments are now added without them, updating the mod should automaticly remove them.

(Oh my god tracking this down was annoying)

**Forum Post**: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25091.0>
**Download**: <https://github.com/Lukas22041/Arkship/raw/main/Arkships.zip>
https://imgur.com/MI7sY5O.gif

items.name: Arsenal Expansion
items.summary: A content expansion mod that adds new ships, weapons and fighter wings that aim to fit in with the vanilla game's content while still offering new ideas. Additionally includes some campaign-level content.
items.description:
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/ucj5cqk.png[/img]

Hello! This is my ship pack mod. It adds a variety of new ships and fighter wings to the Persean Sector, including
several that attempt to blend in with Starsector's base content while still throwing some unique ideas into the mix.

You'll also be able to find everything new used across the Sector by the various factions, and might be
able to get your hands on some blueprints so that you and your own colonies can make use of them.

Additionally, there's a test mission included so that you can try out everything the mod has to offer.

Please post feedback! I listen to everything thrown my way.

items.description:
Coming to you like a freight train and truck making love this mod will rock your socks off 100% money back guarantee.
Suggested mods to use with: Big Mags, Ill Advised Modifications (full series),whatever Yunnru makes idk, Seeker

Features 5 "Modules" which should be used separately and will mess faction balance in various ways:

**Pirates but Epic:** gives pirates access to all visible-on-intel-screen faction ships, hullmods, weapons and wings.
**Pirates but Epic-er:** gives pirates  access to all hull/weapon/wing/hullmod specs (unique bosses and etc. included).

**Faction Blender:** gives visible-on-intel-screen factions access to all visible-on-intel-screen faction ships, hullmods, weapons and wings.
**Faction Blender REVENGANCE:** gives all factions access to all faction ships, hullmods, weapons and wings.
**Faction Blender SUPREME:** gives all factions access to all hull/weapon/wing/hullmod specs (unique bosses and etc. included).

items.name: Automated Commands
items.summary:
*Adds hullmods that automatically trigger various orders when certain conditions are achieved*
```
items.description:
*Adds hullmods that automatically trigger various orders when certain conditions are achieved*
```
 * Retreat when the ship is below a certain hull integrity level. (90% or 60% or 30%)
 * Retreat when the ship has exceeded its peak performance time.
 * Retreat when the ship is below a certain CR level. (60% or 40% or 0%)
 * Retreat when the ship has no missile left. (the hullmod can only be added to ships with least one missile weapon equipped)

 * Override the personality for non-officered ships (should work for flagship on auto)
 * Vent when flux above 80%. This does not activate while the ship is manually being piloted by the player
```
__Download:__ https://github.com/borgrel/AutomatedCommands/releases/download/v1.2a/AutomatedCommands.v1.2a.zip

items.name: Autosave
items.summary: This mod reminds you when you haven't saved in a while, and can optionally save automatically for you.
items.description: This mod will warn you when you haven't saved in a while, and give a short description of how much has happened since your last save. By default it won't force a save (as Starsector's saving process can take quite a while with many mods installed), but you can enable autosaves by editing [i]saves/common/lw_autosave_settings.json.data[/i] after running the mod once.

items.name: Azur Lane Portrait Pack
items.summary: Add anime-theme wives from Azur Lane to your portrait, emphasizing the bust shot. Over 300+ portraits and 100+ unique ship girls.
items.description:
[size=5][b]Update 1.6 released![/b] [/size][font=Verdana][size=4]Add every rarity available ship girls from Iris Libre. [/size][/font]
[font=Trebuchet MS]
[/font][size=4]We're almost completing the core UR/SSR waifu rosters! Next up may update one by one nation (but with SR/R rarity) or maybe release everything but expect months of no updates at worst. Sorry![/size][size=4]
[/size]
[b][i][size=5][Description][/size][/i][/b]

[size=3] ﻿It simply was my side hobby to make my favorite waifu appear in-game since another pack from other authors doesn't have some of my favorites... then it turned into a more significant project for the sake of completing rosters. Might as well share it for anyone to use freely.[/size]

[i][b][size=5][What is the No Jail version?][/size]

﻿*Exiled from the land of badonkerphobia, [i][b]I welcome thee ye fellow degenerate, to oppaitopia. T[/b][/i]his mod pack will be maintained by TiGreXtreme.*

[size=5] ﻿[/size][/b][/i]For starters, it sent anyone that may resemble loli or a teen to the FBI federation for safety and kept all the mature-looking ship girls in this pack. Pick this for your safety from the FBI watchlist!

﻿ ﻿Some examples to consider as the federation's watchlist

[list]

[font=Verdana][b][Still wanna read a description? Sure, why don't I tell you about my story a bit?][/b][/font]

[spoiler][font=Verdana][size=3]So I downloaded the Azur Lane portrait pack from another creator, and I feel like It's good... but... this won't be enough...

[/size][/font][font=Comic Sans MS][size=5]I want a bust shot of waifu portraits.[/size][/font][size=3]

[/size][size=3][font=Verdana]Then one day I set out on my journey to create my own collection of[/font] [/size][font=Verdana][size=3]Azur Lane waifu during my free time.[/size][/font][font=Comic Sans MS][size=5] [/size][/font][size=3]With my[/size][size=5] [/size][size=3]newfound [/size][s]horny[/s][size=3] determination, I decided to begin with SSR/UR tier first, crop my favorite waifu and then I thought to myself,[/size]

[font=Comic Sans MS][size=5]Those skin's [s]badonkers[/s] assets are so good! Why not give them the skins too![/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=3]
after that attempt...
[/size][/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS][size=5][b]why stop there when I can fill up all of the waifu rosters.[/b][/size][/font]
[size=5][font=Verdana]
[/font][/size][font=Verdana][size=3]And after I finished with some cropping, I then tried to calculate a bit, how much time it would take to finish all of them.[/size]
[size=2]and boy oh boy... I guess I'm a masochist...
[/size][size=1]even more so if I include SR and lower rarity too...
[/size][size=3]
[/size][size=3]So for now... I'd like to share my pain and some of these portraits with those who find them [s]arousing[/s] interesting.
Enjoy.
[/size]And thank you for coming to my ted talk.
[size=5][/spoiler]
Q&A[/size]

[size=3]Q: Why so much text? You could just share and be done with it.[/size]
[size=3]A: I'd like to make myself feel some sense of pride and accomplishment from my time spent on this little project. And it's tidy to my eyes.[/size]

[size=3]Q: Will you be making the SR version and the lower one too?[/size]
[size=3]A: I might... if I have time and willpower... or if the demand is high, I don't know.[/size]

[size=3]Q: Can you adjust [*insert character name here*]?[/size]
[size=3]A: I might be able to? So let me know if you find any portrait that feels off.[/size]

[size=3]Q: Some waifu still have the background/jagged edge/white lines though...[/size]
[size=3]A: It's currently the only image I could find [/size][s][size=2]and I want to prioritize completing rosters first so,[/size][/s][size=3] please share the source if you find a better one. I want to make it better [/size][s][size=2]after everything is complete[/size][/s][size=3] when I have the motivation to do so.[/size]

items.name: Balanced (Redacted) Core Drops
items.summary: Adjusted (Redated) ai core drop rates, so farming their fleets no longer grants unlimited (alpha) cores and therefore money.
items.description:
Gameversion: 0.9.1a

Adjusted [Redated] ai core drop rates, so farming their fleets no longer grants unlimited (alpha) cores and therefore money. 
Alpha cores were removed from [Redacted] ship drops, so the Nexus needs to be killed to get it, beta and gamma drop rates are reduced by about 40%. 
The second version of the mod still allows [Redacted] capitals to drop alpha cores, tho rather rare.
Ai core drop chances from exploration are not changed by this mod.

Likely not compatible with other mods changing core drop chances in: data\campaign\procgen\drop_groups.csv

To install the mod, unzip the file and move the adjustedredactedcoredrops folder into your "Fractal Softworks\Starsector\mods" directory. Then enable it in the launcher.
Should be install and removable without any issues.

items.name: Belter Free Navy (The Expanse)
items.summary: What do you think happened to the ships that went "dutch"?
items.description:
When the Free Navy entered the mass infused ring gate, who would have thought that the beings from the other side would spit them back out through a gate in the sector. Single ships in the past that went dutch likely were either destroyed by remnants or ran out of supplies and lie derelict. Marco with enough ships at his disposal, even if he failed back on Earth will at least create a home for belters here.

Current WIP mod to bring the Expanse's free navy into starsector.

As of this moment 4 ships have been added:

[list]
[*]Donnager Battleship (Capital Ship)
[*]Pella Light Cruiser (Cruiser)
[*]Tachi Corvette class frigate(Destroyer)
[*]Morrigan Patrol Destroyer(Frigate)
[/list]
Each ship as loaded out with a plethora of small hybrid turret slots, with varying missile hardpoints, or built in missile tubes designed to be loosely lore accurate.

Weapons:
[list]
[*]2 Large missile weapons, with either fragmentation or High Explosive warheads
[*]2 Medium missile weapons, with either fragmentation or High Explosive warheads
[*]2 Small missile weapons, with either fragmentation or High Explosive warheads
[*]1 Small ballistic PDC that uses energy damage calculation.
[*]1 large long range Foehammer railgun.
[*]1 large keel mounted railgun.
[*]1 medium keel mounted railgun.
[/list]
Since this is early on, ship models and weapon sprites are all subject to replace. I'm awful at art, but will eventually commission better models, if the desire/need is there.

[size=3]TIPS ON COMBAT [/size] [size=2] 

You don't need to rely on your shields. Ships have ample armor and high mobility + burst DPS. This allows you and your fleet with proper positioning to perform fly by strafing runs aided with large quantities of fragmentation torpedo's to deal damage with hit and run wolfpack tactics. ships have a tiny 2 degree shield to protect you from ramming (protects AI ships from insta divebombing to their deaths into stations at the start of a battle) Beware of high explosive lasers. Ships that can equip railguns do not have adequate flux dissipation to spam railguns relentlessly, so use them wisely for burst DPS, or when you vastly outclass the enemy vessel.[/size]

The ships not balanced.

with plenty of OP for each ship, you're able to fill them out with many hullmods. All ship weapons have extremely long ranges. The PDC's however have relatively slow projectiles making them only mildly effective at longer ranges, especially when ships are moving.

Ships also have their max speed set to 600(the in game limit) with varying levels of acceleration, and all deceleration is set to 0, meaning you can go really fast, but you'll also have to flip and burn if you want to slow down.

I'd like to make lateral thrusters extremely minimal in effect, but unfortunately you still have quite a bit of lateral control, but you still sort of get the effects of relativistic flight.

I'm planning creating an actual in game faction of belters with Marco Inaros leading the helm, but I figured I'd at least get the ships out there for people to play with while I figure out how the actual in game faction spawning works, since there is a lot less documentation on that.

If anyone has any tips on how to integrate a faction, please send them my way.

Installation is the same as any mod, extract into mods folder and then mark the mod as active in the launcher.

items.name: Blackrock Drive Yards
items.summary: [0.9.1a] - Adds the Blackrock Drive Yards Corporation, an unscrupulous corporate faction-state that has isolated itself in the southeast fringe of the Core Worlds.
items.description:
Main features:

This mod includes a massive amount of new ships, weapons and other content, is fully compatible with GraphicsLib with shader maps and other content, and integrated with Nexerelin.

Notes on gameplay:

Blackrock ships have bad to mediocre shields, average armor, good flux stats, excellent mobility, lots of firepower, and mix all weapon types. Every ship has a built-in boost to active flux vent rate, meaning they can easily reset flux if given a breather: something you'll want to be doing often, due to mediocre shields and armor.

Most of the faction's warships are excellent at crushing valuable targets and picking apart slow, but powerful foes. On the other hand, they struggle in fights where they can't find any breathing room for hit-and-run attacks, or against a numerically superior enemy that can flank and surround them. Using the faction's weapons, ships can be built for either high risk/high reward play, or low risk/low reward play. Certain ships break the mold and afford different playstyles.

This mod includes a massive amount of new ships, weapons and other content, is fully compatible with GraphicsLib with shader maps and other content, and integrated with Nexerelin.*

> Since this question keeps coming up and since I still can't work on the mod, I took some time to think about it today. I'm ok with independent compatibility patches, provided:
> 
> - Any such update should be made available with the understanding that I do not explicitly endorse it beforehand, and without the expectation of me vetting it before or after it gets uploaded
> - It should have its own version number for clarity in case of any future, fork-induced, bug reporting complexity
Cycerin and/or Tartiflette may take BRDY back over in the future, but **for now please direct any bug reports my way.** 
Enjoy. Requires Lazy, Graphics, and Magiclib, and Starsector 0.95.1a-RC6.

items.description:
*Currently incompatible with BDSM, because their scripts are uncompiled (but otherwise fully compatible).*

With BlockTags, all you need to make a vanilla hullmod incompatible with one of your own is a tag with the vanilla hullmod's id, and "_block" at the end of it.

Two mods because vanilla's loose script hullmods need to be compiled, but also need to be loaded *first* so mods like BDSM can overwrite them.

(Please tell me if I missed any vanilla incompatibilities, I had a headache by the end of this so my concetration wasn't the greatest.)

items.description:
[b][url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=4106.0]Console commands[/url][/b]
[font=Courier New]PrintChatterChars[/font]: List all remembered officers and their current chatter character. Optional all arg: instead lists all characters that exist in the game.
[font=Courier New]SetChatterChar [officer name] [character ID][/font]: Assigns the specified chatter character to the officer in the player fleet with the best match for the provided name. Note: Full name is searched first, then surname, then given name.

[b]Configuration[/b]
[font=Courier New]chatterConfig.json[/font] lets you turn off low-value and/or ally chatter.
To add/modify lines and personalities, look in [font=Courier New]data/config/chatter[/font]. ([url=https://bitbucket.org/Histidine/combat-chatter/wiki/Faction%20specific%20chatter]Help with faction-specific chatter[/url])

items.name: Common Radar
items.summary: This mod adds a simple, classically-styled radar to the combat interface.
items.description:
This mod adds a simple radar to the combat user interface.

[size=4][b]Legend:[/b][/size]
[list]
[*][b]Zoom level[/b] is shown as four small white lines perpendicular to the cardinal directions. How close they are to the radar's center depends on the current zoom level. Zoom is controlled with [b]+/-[/b].
[*][b]Ships[/b] are drawn as solid-colored shapes. Phased ships will appear faded on the radar, and your ship's current target will have a white marker drawn around it.
[*][b]Shields[/b] will have their active arcs shown in blue.
[*][b]Missiles[/b] are small colored dots; purple for enemy missiles, dark green for allied ones.
The brightness of the dot varies based on how much damage that missile deals, so an Atropos torpedo (2,000 damage) is much more noticeable than an Annihilator swarm (200 damage each). Missiles that are locked onto the player ship are colored orange. Missiles that have burnt out are considered enemies as they can hit either side at that point.[*][b]Missile lock status[/b] is displayed at the top left of the radar box. If any guided missiles are in view and locked onto the player
ship, an orange missile icon will appear here. The brightness of this icon depends on the most threatening missile currently locked on.[*][b]Asteroids[/b] are small white dots.
[*][b]Objectives[/b] are large hollow diamonds.
[*][b]Retreat areas[/b] are shaded yellow.
[*][b]Map borders[/b] are shown as red lines, with a gray void beyond to show inaccessible areas.
[*][b]Combat readiness[/b] for the player ship is shown as a vertical bar to the right of the radar. Current CR is shown in [b][color=#00ffff]cyan[/color][/b], CR lost in the current battle in [b][color=#0000ff]dark blue[/color][/b], and unobtained CR in [b][color=#404040]dark gray[/color][/b]. The bar will slowly flash if you are currently losing CR and flash
faster as malfunction risk rises. For ships that don't lose CR this bar will be faded to be less obtrusive. If you are playing in campaign, your ship's maximum CR given the current captain and crew is shown as a horizontal white line.[*][b]Battle progress[/b] is shown as a bar along the bottom of the radar. It's based on the fleet points remaining on each side, so the larger the
green portion is, the closer to victory you are. Allied ships are shown as a darker portion of each side's bar. A side's portion of the bar will flash if they are in full retreat. The relative fleet strengths at battle start is shown as a vertical white line so you can quickly tell if you're doing better than your opponent.[/list]

items.name: Console Commands
items.summary: An unofficial developer's console for Starsector.
items.description:
This mod adds a developer's console to Starsector that can be summoned with [b]control+backspace[/b]. This (along with many other settings) can be changed by running the Settings command. Other mods can add their own console commands or override base commands; instructions for adding custom commands can be found in a document in the root of the mod folder.

A list of commands that work in the current game context can be found with "help", or a full list of commands with "help all". Multiple commands can be run by separating them with a semicolon (;), and a new line can be started with shift+enter.

This mod should be compatible with all other mods, and can be added to or removed from a save at any time.

items.name: Crew Replacer
items.summary:
an modders utility library thing.
Forum:
items.description:
an modders utility library thing.
Forum:
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=24249.msg360489#msg360489
what is Crew Replacer?
Crew Replacer is a mod library built with one goal in mind: to make it easy and quick to mod in new items to be used in jobs. crew replacer lets multiple modders modify the same tasks, by adding a system that lets a modder add an 'crew'(really any type of commodity) to an 'job'. were said 'job's replace all the instances of crew I could find in code.

but what dose that mean? it means that modders now have a system to to change what is used/required when the one tries to 'salvage' or 'survey' or 'raid'. it also means that modders have a system to add new jobs into the game, then let other modders change what is used/required in said task.
updated to version 0.3.4
```
V0.3.4
    -fixes:
        fixed supplyDemandChange crashing the 
game because of bad code when supply change was ran.
    please dont get used supplyDemandClass being in 
crewReplacer. its going to be moved into its own project in an month or 3. so if you do need it for something it might be better to wait for that
```

items.name: Custom Battle Music
items.summary: This mod is made in order to add custom battle music to the game.
items.description:
This mod is made in order to add custom battle music to the game.
You can now add songs that fit factions for the base game or even from mods.
It is very easy to modify and implement.[left]Now contains music for every major faction in the game.
[/left]
[left][img]https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/Laroustine/mod-starsector-battle-music/total?style=flat-square[/img][/left]
[left][b][u][size=4]For Developers:[/size][/u][/b][/left]To add compatibility for your mod you just need to add this in your [b].faction[/b]
[code]
"music": {
  "battle": "music_faction_battle"
}
[/code]
and you also need to add the list of songs for your faction in the config file [b]sounds.json[/b].
[code]
{
  "music": {
    "music_faction_battle": [
      {
        "source": "sounds/music/",
        "volume": 0.15,
        "file": "song1.ogg"
      }
    ]
  }
}
[/code]
The name of the list of songs can be different from the one above and need to be different from any other existing list.
You can also use song lists present in the game already.

[size=4][color=blue][u][url=https://github.com/Laroustine/mod-starsector-battle-music/releases]Changelog[/url][/u][/color][/size]

Fight the [b]Blade Breakers[/b], an AI-enslaved faction with shadowy motives and unclear goals, designed around doing mobile-alpha-damage trickery right back to you - with interest. Blow up their ships, salvage their bases for loot, and steal their gear - their weapons are highly effective, and some of their AI-controlled drone ships can be used as auxiliaries in your own fleets. 
Blade Breakers spawn in a single fixed constellation to the galactic South, with optional procedural spawns that you can enable in the settings file. Look out for special, hardened warning beacons with unique intel icons.

items.name: Diable Avionics
items.summary: Claiming ownership over millions of people's possessions might seem like a bold claim, but that is one the Diable Avionics Corporation intends to enforce, with deadly means if necessary.
items.description:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/81PQJJdh.png[/img]


[b]TO: CITIZENS OF SECTOR 7[/b]
[b](And to whom else it may concern)[/b]

[b]PURSUANT TO CLAUSE 9.1.1[/b] [i]of agreement dated[/i] 83.06.01 [i]made between[/i] yourself ([i]as contractee[/i]) [i]and[/i] [b]DOMAIN OF MAN [/b]([i]as the registered owner of SECTOR 7[/i])[i] and these habited systems including but not limited to:[/i] [b]Corvus, Askonia, Arcadia, Eos, Magec, Gneiss, and Valhalla[/b] [i]have been repossessed and any interest therein is determined absolutely.

All inquiries relating to property should be addressed to: [b]Junior Treasury Accountant Cristo [/b]

Any persons entering these systems, attempting to enter or assisting others to enter without the registered owner's permission will be [b]TERMINATED with prejudice.[/b][/i]


[center][url=https://i.imgur.com/970Qpoh.png][img]https://i.imgur.com/970Qpohh.png[/img][/url][/center]


[i][u][size=4]GAMEPLAY[/size][/u][/i]


The Diable Avionics play similarly to Mid-tech: using their superior mobility to choose their engagements and overwhelm isolated targets. The subtility they add is that their ships are generally individually slightly inferior to Vanilla ones, but synergize very well with their wings of Wanzers: mech-like strike-crafts that pack a superior punch but susceptible to enemy fire. To help them carry their missions, most ships tend to saturate the enemy's PD with swarms of micro-missiles.

﻿A typical successful engagement against Diable Avionics fleets generally requires a solid phalanx of anti-fighter weapons to break the initial Wanzer and missile waves and a decisive counter-strike while their carriers are still rebuilding their strike-craft support.


[i][u][size=4]CONTENT SHOWCASE[/size][/u][/i]

[center][spoiler][url=https://i.imgur.com/hX9ZSQH.jpg][img]https://i.imgur.com/hX9ZSQHh.jpg[/img][/url][/spoiler][/center]


Features advanced transforming ships:

[img]http://i.imgur.com/xuaQHch.gif[/img]    [img]http://i.imgur.com/XVMGrtC.gif[/img]    [img]https://i.imgur.com/GG7XXH7.gif[/img]


[i][u][size=4]ALTERNATIVE SKIN MODS[/size][/u][/i]

Customize your fleet using one of [url=https://www.patreon.com/posts/44573931]these alternative skin pack mods.[/url] Only activate one in the launcher along with the main mod, you can swap them as often as you want without issue.

[url=https://imgur.com/a/JIYc9nQ]Here are some resources to easily make your own custom skin![/url] I eagerly await to see what others may come up with for custom paint jobs. I would gladly feature popular skin pack mods in the collection.


[center][size=3][i][u]Bug Tracker and Feedback form[/u][/i]:[/size]
You have some feedback to share and want to make sure I do not miss it? You can use [url=https://forms.gle/YbQ8cYUA5QaJBCYV8]this google form[/url] to leave me a comment.


This mod is quite packed with content. When used with other large mods you may need to allocate additional memory.
Visit the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=10931.0]Modding troubleshooting guide[/url] on the official forum for guidance, or join the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=11488.0]Unofficial Discord server[/url].


[b]Credits: [/b]
[i]FlashFrozen[/i] for the original mod and designs.
[i]Tartiflette[/i] for the artworks, animations and scripting
[i]Debido[/i] for the Thunderbolt scripts.


You like the mod? Help to make it better: Donations will be used to commission content I cannot create myself, such as illustrations or music. Additionally, if you would enjoy playing with a custom paint job I also take commissions for a reasonable rate. PM me for more details on the Forum or Discord.

[url=https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=WYWX8DR5WPV8G][img]https://i.imgur.com/bAIZOoi.png[/img][/url] [url=https://www.patreon.com/tartiflette][img]https://i.imgur.com/odD0uZQ.png[/img][/url]

[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=375.0]Made with Trylobot and Deathfly's Ship Editor[/url]
[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13976.0]Made using SafariJohn's Rules Tool[/url][/center][center][url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13976.0][/url][/center]

items.name: Diktat Enhancement
items.summary: Ever felt the Sindrian Diktat was too weak as a faction? Ever wanted to see it actually do anything in Nexerelin games without flopping and dying as soon as another faction remembers it exists?
items.description:
Ever felt the Sindrian Diktat was too weak as a faction? Ever wanted to see it actually do anything in Nexerelin games without flopping and dying as soon as another faction remembers it exists?

Well look no further! This mod considerably buffs up the Sindrian Diktat to somewhere between Tri-Tachyon and PL/Hegemony level of size and power. Unfortunately no ships are added since other mods(SWP, Ludd and Lions) have already added those, however this mod instead gives them a new system and new markets.

Now also giving some love to Tri-Tachyon(maybe a bit too much love).

Now compatible with PAGSM(hopefully).

**Partially save compatible - Won’t crash your game if loaded in the midst of a save, but many features(primarily markets) will not be applied to the existing savegame**

**Requires Nexerelin**

```
Changes:
- Compatibility update with PAGSM, added markets now have different descriptions when PAGSM is used(highly recommended to be used with an upcoming PAGSM compatibility update for DE)
- Compatibility update with 0.95.1a-RC6
```

**Download Below**

items.name: Dohna Dohna Industries
items.summary: This mod adds three industries and three commodities themed after the Alicesoft RPG Dohna Dohna. This mod does not contain any explicit NSFW material, however the content alludes to NSFW actions.
items.description:
[b][size=3]Disclaimer: This mod contains references to human trafficking. As the author of this mod, I would like to make it abundantly clear that in any real life setting, human trafficking is not something I support nor will I ever support it. There is a firm line between reality and fiction that should never be crossed. Let us keep it uncrossed.[/size]

[/b]
[center]﻿[/center][center][img]https://i.imgur.com/8b8FH5Q.png[/img]

[/center]﻿
[size=3]Welcome to the Dohna Dohna Industries mod. This mod adds three industries to the game themed after activities in Dohna Dohna and three commodities to support them. It also installs these industries on a few pirate locations on new game. Despite the NSFW themes, there is no explicit NSFW content (such as full frontal nudity) in this mod.

[/size]At present, the mod is relatively barebones and has a couple issues I'm looking to solve as I get better at making mods.
Currently Known Issues:
The icon for the commodity "Capture Girls" is too tall.
Adding all three industries to the few pirate locations causes them to have too many industries and suffer a massive stability penalty.
Commodities lack descriptions (I'll get to it eventually).

items.name: ED Shipyard
items.description:
```
Save compatible with anything after 2.4.X
Safe to add mid playthrough

* Balance changes to the leonberger based on feedback (better assault variant and a slight buff to its phase stats and movement)
* Dust missiles move a bit slower and have fewer HP to make the more vulnerable to AoE PD
* Slightly improved AI Wurg usage of MAW weapon and Tyrant Eye system
* Rebalanced phase ships vs Vanilla, ~10% less phase cost (improved variants also)
* ED Shipyard locations now spawn defensive fleets when threatened as well as have delivery fleets
* Ship and variant changes for the newfoundland so the AI can use it semi-effectively
* Fixed Memory leak with Newfoundland
* No longer create submarkets at locations that already have non-standard submarkets (Kassadar)
* More SO variants for smaller ships
* Shield breaker weapons are now much more powerful, but they still seem like a bad idea except in specific situations so I guess that's balance?
* Riptide doesn't take damage from ship explosions so it doesn't blow itself up constantly

```

Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=24976.0
Download: https://bitbucket.org/NickWWest/edshipyard/downloads/EDShipyard.2.5.3.zip

Forum Link: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25401.0

```Fast, Safe, Functional aka FSF Corporation is a military corporation founded after the Collapse to sell arms and OEM ships. Its founding dates back to a pre-Collapse powerful smuggling ring, with ties to many of the equipment testing units of the Domain of Man, selling prototypes to various corporations at high prices. With the failure of the Gates, the upper echelons of the syndicate were trapped in a secret warehouse in Perseus. Knowing that the power at their disposal was far from sufficient to protect the precious cargo in the warehouse, they relied on the mountains of supplies within to completely disappear from the incoming disputes and set up the FSF predecessor as an underground organization.

In the golden age after the First AI War, the sporadic appearance of foreign trade warships that people had never seen before in the defense of the Edge World colonies symbolized the FSF's emergence on the Perseus scene as the giant corporation known today for providing, among other things, shipbuilding, military instruction, and weapons trade. Although they have always been a mega-corporation following the laws of the Hegemony throughout the Sector, in recent years their fleet numbers have risen steeply to show their ambition.```
Adds the eponymous faction, a few new mechanics, a quest alongside a plethora or ships and weapons.

Note that release may have some translation errors or idiosyncrasies. Please contact me if you find any.

items.name: Fast Engine Rendering
items.summary: Uses modern OpenGL rendering techniques to efficiently render custom engine plumes. The main purpose of this mod is a performance boost, taking advantage of modern GPU horsepower. The increase is found through removing CPU load and transferring it to the GPU, which vanilla starsector does not take advantage tremendously.
items.description:
Uses modern OpenGL rendering techniques to efficiently render custom engine plumes. The main purpose of this mod is a performance boost, taking advantage of modern GPU horsepower. The increase is found through removing CPU load and transferring it to the GPU, which vanilla starsector does not take advantage tremendously.

Requires a GPU that supports OpenGL 3.3

```
v1.1.0
-updated shader code to optimised versions from Jon Micheelsen
-tweaked glow visuals
-fixed bugs with system activated engines for good hopefully
-reload engine data with F8
-fixed bug with force override setting```

Features:
> Replace SHIP (and fighter) engine plumes and glows with a fast instanced renderer. Moderate testing suggests a ~25% increase in performance in large battles with many fighter/ships, your mileage may vary.
> Crisp 😩 👌 and smooth engine visual

Caveats:
> Does not affect missile engines, they will still use vanilla behaviour. Engine colour changing has been implemented for Safety Overrides, Plasma Jets and Plasma Burn, however any other modded effects will not take effect because it is hardcoded, this is not fixable unfortunately.
**Download:** https://github.com/automatopaste/fast-engine-rendering/releases/download/v1.1.0/FastEngineRendering_v1.1.0.zip

adds a set of hullmods that can be used to filter weapons by range, damage type & function

**questions I'll probably get**
"I added the hullmod and now my ship is 10k+ op over the max, help!" - this is a limitation with how the game handles unequippable weapons (if a weapon's op cost is above 10k it can't be equipped), unfortunately it can't be fixed
"Why isn't there a filter for X" - Because I don't want too many & couldn't really be bothered to make more, if there's demand for more filters I'll add them later

**todo (not a promise)**
add a description to the main hullmod that breaks down the current filters
get nice icons for the filters
oh yeah the third one was wing filters 

**Requires lazylib**

items.name: G1GC vmparam Collection v.1.1.1 (0.95.1 Compatible)
items.summary: Note: the only compatible Java 8 are version 271, please check pinned post in <#512356777451323393>
items.description:
Note: the only compatible Java 8 are version 271, please check pinned post in <#512356777451323393>

Download
Windows:
https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1tO6rxVPQQS4ICgWNzHUFbjiPa6AgXYhQ&export=download
Linux Distro:
https://drive.google.com/uc?id=1GmvL4H43r6PmvZbzKqzHNC7tHM7U0fZm&export=download
MacOS:
https://drive.google.com/uc?id=124yMChlacYYdosEngoDhQtOl7Kk1PCUb&export=download

Changelogs :
```
-Disable SystemGC, its unnecessary (JRE7/JRE8)
-Show Error Dialog instead of failing to launch silently (JRE8)
-Now come in three different flavor for Windows, Linux-based Distro, MacOS
```

Ever frustrated why your startup loading times is so awful?, got a high-end PC and want to use more of its memory size and speed?, or optimize your potato laptop to play this game?.. we got you covered with 1/2/3/4/6/8GB VMParam. Brought to you lovingly after a week of testing.

```
Packs Included:
- JRE7 Safe Pack
- JRE8 Safe/Aggresive/Dangerous Pack
- For 1/2/3/4/6/8GB
- G1GC Hide Leak Messages mods
```

Key differences between packs
All share the same trait of having a low latency multi-threaded GC (the janitor you may call it) to reclaim unused memory and make the game smooth. For starter I recommending the Safe pack but if you trust your high end PC to pack a punch do give Dangerous pack a go. As for people who're curious about what this do read the Documentation.txt included on each pack.

Known issues
```
- Due to how the mod works, the game may show "Memory Leak! Campaign Duplicates" over time. This is okay!

- However if one of your mod list does have a memory leak.. this mod may fail to clean extra copies.
```

Fully save compatible! If the game doesn't launch after you replace the `vmparam` and you're using JRE8 pack, make sure the `jre` folder is already swapped with JRE8!

It is 80dp to field instead of the normal 40dp because its keeping its autoforge and will be WAY stronger in the players hands, also its 1.5mil to build.

PM me here on discord if you find bugs or problems

* Full Energy variant 60dp 1mil to build
* Full Ballistic variant 60dp 1mil to build
* Full Missile variant 160dp 3.5mil to build
1.1- updated mod name to Guardian Prototype from "Human Guardian"

items.name: Guts' Sword from Berserk got thrown into Starsector by the Godhand
HMI Supervillains 0.0.4: Mini-Beta-Campaign-Layer-Update
items.summary: The Draco Group and the Fang Society are two truly deranged factions that inhabit the south-western part of the sector. Both organisations suffer from an obsession with gene-modding to go above conventional humanity in strength, speed, intelligence - and cruelty.
items.description:
The Draco Group and the Fang Society are two truly deranged factions that inhabit the south-western part of the sector. Both organisations suffer from an obsession with gene-modding to go above conventional humanity in strength, speed, intelligence - and cruelty.

The Draco Group, aristocratic and cold, harvest populations to imbibe their blood in their hedonistic rituals, reaving on high-speed high-tech ships from the system of Prester John. The Fang Society, animalistic and vicious, prey on defenseless peoples to consume, eat and torture, roaming the sector from heavily armoured ships.

While their hatred for the Sector is well know, their loathing for each other is even greater. It is for this reason that their impact on the Sector at large is relatively minor, as they are more content to butcher each other.

*0.0.4 Changes*

-Both Fang and Draco have had their markets beefed up, and their faction stats overhauled.
-Added spicy boss-ish fleets to Phylum and Prestor John systems.
-Added Two MagicBounties, giving you a chance to find and use some truly despicable boats.
-Fiddled with a lot of the stats.
-Lots of tiny little fixes.

*Savegame Compatible, but beyond the MagicBounties you won't see new stuff without a new game*

DOWNLOAD:
https://bitbucket.org/King_Alfonzo/i-will-make-sindria-great-again/downloads/HMI_Supervillains_0_0_4.zip

items.name: Half Maintenance Costs
items.summary:
I didn't like constant maintenance costs for ships being so high. I halved the cost.

Updated for 0.95.1a.
items.description: This mod simply halves the data in the "supplies/mo" column on the "ship_data.csv" file for every ship. This means supplies are normal for everything in the game, except ships use half their vanilla amounts for maintenance.

items.name: Hatsune Miku On The Side Of A Pandemonium
Hazard Mining Incorporated
items.summary: A quasi-legal commercial enterprise at the edge of the Core Worlds, Hazard Mining Incorporated is ostensibly a mining company. In reality it is a predatory corporation that utilises brigantry and piracy to squeeze as much profit from the Outer Rim as possible.
items.description:
A quasi-legal commercial enterprise at the edge of the Core Worlds, Hazard Mining Incorporated is ostensibly a mining company. In reality it is a predatory corporation that utilises brigantry and piracy to squeeze as much profit from the Outer Rim as possible.

Current Actual Real version Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/5e88z3mdwjs9eyg/HMI_0_3_4l.zip?dl=1

**ALPHA 0.3.5**
***NOT Savegame compatible.***

-Reworked all HMI weapons. A lot of weapons have been completely redone in form and function, and just about everything has been tweaked.
-Added a *lot* more weapons to fill some niches.
-Added two new techmined fighters; a heavy, powerful fighter and a high-tech antimatter bomber.

-Removed Decimator; this ship has been replaced with the Vanguard / Brawler.
-Removed the Finch (No one remembers this).
-Removed the Drone Firing system from the Whiskey Priest and Donkey due to rare CTD crash, instead they have dedicated suicide drone wings.
-Bombardment Pod no longer fires Annhiliators. Instead, it fires *itself*.

-Rejigged how HMI ships and weapons show up; they should be less common in Scavenger, Independent and Pirate fleets.
-Reworked HMI variants.
-Fixed a lot of other minor problems + mis-spellings

**Update 0.3.5b**
-Added 3 new weapons (Chances some of these will be cut from next version)
-Fiddled with a couple of stats and visuals
-Added six new Me[REDACTED] ships
-Added The Third Phase for the [REDACTED] station fight (WIP)

**Update 0.3.5c**
-Added three new Unstable Me[REDACTED] ships
-Made the Mess Scarier

**Update 0.3.5d**
-Fixed a code of Mysterious Origin; Secret Bosses will now properly drop blueprints.

Download NOT SAVE GAME COMPATIBLE (EXCEPT WITH PREVIOUS ALPHA VERSION) version here:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/7zxdqn5wn468j5n/HMI_0_3_5d.zip?dl=1

Please give me a yell if anything goes wrong.

[/size][/url]﻿﻿﻿[url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/j0jcxlvaj8bfs1s/HyperionSystems%200.9.1-a1%20HOTFIX.zip?dl=0][size=3]Dropbox[/size][/url][/center]
[center]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]

[color=#ff0000][size=5][center]Requires [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=5444.0][b]LazyLib[/b][/url], [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13718.0][b]MagicLib[/b][/url], [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=10982.0][b]GraphicLib[/b][/url][/center]
[/size][/color]
[size=3][center]Histidine's [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=9175.0]Nexerelin[/url], LazyWizard's [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=8181.0]Version Checker[/url] is included with Nexerelin
Tartiflette's [url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=12041.0]Unknown Skies[/url]
Sundog's [url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=15321.0]Starship Legends[/url]
SirHartley's [url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=18011.0]Industrial Evolution[/url] and [url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=20986.0]Grand Colonies[/url]
Timid's [url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=17103.0]Better Colonies[/url]
[s]Kentington's [url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=17556.0]DIY Planets[/url][/s] Still waiting for a 0.95.1a update[/center][/size]

[center][size=3]This mod will be [i][color=teal]expanded slowly[/color][/i], will add Hyperion Systems (ie. Hegemony) and Confederacy missions.[/size]
[size=3]REMINDER: All the ships are [i][color=#9900ff]imperfectly" kitbashed[/color][/i], and [color=#980000]"slightly" unbalanced[/color].[/size][/center]

[center]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]

[b][size=5][center]History of Hyperion Systems:[/center][/size][/b]
[left][size=3]Hyperion Systems, or Hyperion as it was called back at the Human Domain-era is one of the largest ship and weapons manufacturer that competed against the Tri-Tachyon Corporation. They originally designed and patented the first Phase-class ships and technologies that the Domain Fleet usually use. Hyperion Systems was founded on Mars at the later stages of the Sol System being fully colonized, recruited and commissioned by Earth's Space Expeditionary Force to build new and high-tech equipment, systems, and later ships and weapons for the rapid expansion of the Human race in the universe.[/size][/left][size=3]
[/size][right][size=3]It was then at commented and written by Ayomide Callisto at the days of the Hyperspace Expansion-era that FTL technology was developed "originally" by the Tri-Tachyon Corporation, but what they did not realized that Hyperion Systems was the first corporation that developed in the cover of secrecy the phase-class ships commissioned by Earth's Space Expeditionary Force to send as scouts in other sectors. These scout ships were the Cassiopeia-class and Eridani-class ships.[/size][/right][size=3]
[/size][left][size=3]Later, as the Human Domain-era collapsed and the gates were abandoned and deactivated, many of the ships and blueprints of these ships were transferred to the Persean Sector by the Hegemony and the Tri-Tachyon Corporation, but then subsequently "lost" due to the internal Persean Sector conflicts that happened after. As the sector slowly had its peace and silence, the knowledge and blueprints of this ships were found again by some Hegemony soldiers at a hidden, underground military base in the planet Jangala. [/size][/left][size=3]
[/size][right][size=3]Now, Hyperion Systems is no longer an active corporation, but a shell of its former existence running covertly in Hegemony-controlled territory, all their ships are now on the hold of the Hegemony.[/size][/right]

[center]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]

[b][center][size=5]History of Hyperion Confederacy, faction of Hyperion Systems[/size][/center][/b]

Year C+87, the First AI War is occuring in the Persean Sector, Hyperion Systems was already an established corporation working in the shadows and wealth of the Hegemony. While war is happening in the sector, three high ranking officials of the company decided to leave the company and the Hegemony to seek better lives and to create their own government, same as the Persean League's goals.

[right]It was there at one of Jangala's hangars where they set out on their journey. While on the hangars, they decided to grab three ships docked in the hangar, a Naos-class Battlecruiser, a Alycone-class Cruiser, and a Orionis-class Battlecruiser. They hated the way the Hegemony treated, and taxed the people after the collapse. They went and went, fought some Hegemony patrols, and alot of pirates along the way.[/right]
[left]They ended up first at Penelope's Star, they remembered the planet Ithaca, which was on the way of being terraformed, when they got there, they saw that it was in chaos, and the terraforming was halted because of the war. So they left the system and almost gotten defeated by a large remnant fleet. Luckly, they found an unknown star system that the remnant never tried to colonize. But when they entered the star system, they found out a moon of a gas giant was a pirate's city. Sneakily, they got past of some pirate freighter fleet. There they realized the three planets, all habitable, and untouched by any people, nor the pirates landed into the planets. (Though they know it is there.) They thought their ships were empty of people inside, but unbeknownst to the three, they brought a sizeable population from the ships. There they started their quest to start a new lives, and to forge a new government that is free, and open for everyone.[/left][right]
Now, they are a mighty and well established splinter group of the Hegemony and the Hyperion Systems Corporation, and also defended their position in the sector. (Though they left the pirate moon city on their star system.)[/right]

[center][/center][center]﻿--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b][size=5]Ships and Wings[/size][/b][/center]
[center]﻿[img]https://i.imgur.com/bVdiTJQ.png[/img]﻿[/center][center][b]Krakatoa-class Battlecruiser[/b]
Designed in the later stages of the post-domain era as a response to the waves of [REDACTED] ships invading the inner colonies and its peripheries. With its large triangle shaped design and large size and fighter and bomber bays, it will decimate all it encounters.﻿[/center]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/m5fRBtr.png[/img]
[b][/b][b][/b][b]Naos-class Battlecruiser[/b]
The Naos-class Supercruiser was one of the original capital-class ships designed by Hyperion Systems back at the Human Domain-era. It was one of the original ships that was sent as a seedship to colonize other planets via the multi-generational ship. Though, through the years it was slowly redesigned as a Capital-class battleship.[/center][center][img]https://i.imgur.com/6xb1Sny.png[/img]﻿
[b]Orionis-class Phased Battlecruiser[/b]
This ship is one of the original phase-based ships to be designed back at the Human Domain-era. It was originally designed as an experiment, a X-class ship dedicated for studiying phase technology. It was almost lost when the collapse happened, but it was then jump gated by the commander of the ship to the Persean System as a way to escape the problems in the Sol System. It ended up into Hyperion Systems' Persean Sector's orbital laboratories and was re-designed as a phased battleship and manufactured.[/center]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/luWPRcD.png[/img]
[b]Perseus-class Supercarrier[/b]
The original capital carriers designed by Hyperion Systems for the Human Domain Space Forces. It has six hangar bays designed to carry advanced space-based combat, and to drop a large army to a planet.[/center]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/kcOxgs7.png[/img]﻿
[b]Scuti-class Combat Phased Superfreighter[/b]
It is one of the original freighter ship designed by Hyperion Systems' rivals Arcjet Corporation. This was one of the primary freight used by the Human Domain's primary military freight service, but then quickly lost when the collapse happened.[/center]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/9F8LZy1.png[/img]﻿
[b]Arcturus-class Combat Phased Supertanker[/b]
A re-design or a refit of the venerable Prometheus-class heavy tanker, it was conceived by some of the Hegemony's Freight Union to increase the delivery of fuel across the Persean Sector against the original Prometheus. With additional defences of course.[/center][center]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/OIglvmi.png[/img]﻿
[b]Izar-class Combat Phased Troopcarrier[/b]
The successor of the Carinae-class Troop Transport, it is a re-design of the Starliner-class Civilian Transport, redesigned for military troop transport and deployment to planets. Hyperion Systems was chosen to re-design the Starliner-class to a military variant by the Hegemony.[/center][left][/left][center][img]https://i.imgur.com/D4i5VF0.png[/img]﻿
[b]Alycone-class Cruiser[/b]
An old cruiser design, originally designed back at the middle of the Human Domain-era. It was originally manufactured by Hyperion Systems Earth Branch, but the blueprints were quickly shipped to other branches before the collapse happened.[/center]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/wspEK0r.png[/img]﻿
[b]Becrux-class Phased Cruiser
[/b]This phased cruiser was idealized by the Hyperion Systems Persean Sector Jangala Branch back just after the collapse of the Human Domain occurred. This ship was the primary defence of the Hyperion Systems Persean Sector for defending it's trade secrets to the growing problem of anarchy in the system.[/center]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/Qa7wGEH.png[/img]﻿
[b]Carinae-class Destroyer
[/b]Originally designed as a light-to-medium freighter back at the Human Domain-era, it was one of Hyperion Systems' original ships and it was converted into a crew transport just before the collapse. Now it is redesigned as a destroyer of some kind.[/center][right][/right]
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/7m2TsU6.png[/img]﻿
[b]Sirius[/b][b]-class Phased Destroyer
[/b]The Sirius-class phase destroyer was originally a non-phased destroyer designed by the Tri-Tachyon Corporation in the middle of the Human Domain-era. It was then shelved but when the collapse happened the original blueprints were lost in one of the systems near the Persean Sector. It was recovered by Hyperion Systems in one of Persean Sector's gates in an old, abandoned, and damaged Betelgeuse-class Superfreighter originally owned by the 113th Militarized Freight Group that was killed-in-action by swarms of pirates and looters at the Persean Sector as the try to re-activate a gate to another system.[/center][center]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/EUyXgEe.png[/img]﻿
[b]Eridani-class Frigate
[/b]A late Human Domain-era frigate that was originally deployed as a way to counter the defeat in the Battle for Earth. It was then quickly re-manufactured by Hyperion Systems right after the collapse for additional protection of interests.[/center]
[center]﻿[img]https://i.imgur.com/Pe5GioK.png[/img]
[b]Cassiopeia-class Phased Frigate[/b]
This ship is one of the original frigates of the Human Domain Planet Bombardment Fleet, one of this ship is originally used for destroying one large area of a planet from its large, dish-like weapon that was replaced internally with a Thermal Pulse Cannon.[/center]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/xsuWJve.png[/img]
[b]Achernar-class Phased Bomber[/b]
An old, but dependable, and highly capable bomber. Using its quad Atropos torpedoes that is capable of damaging even the most highly armored, and hull amount. Designed by Hyperion Systems for the Naos-class Battlecruiser as a heavy offensive fighter.[/center]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/DnYgGVV.png[/img]﻿
[b]Mintaka-class Phased Interceptor[/b]
A fast and nimble interceptor designed to wipe all enemy bombers, fighters, interceptors, and assault wings. It can also be used to destroy light-to-medium armored targets with its heavy autocannons. Designed to defend any fleet, station, or planet.[/center]

[center]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]

[center][b][size=5]Weapons[/size]

[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/7Ml8guk.png[/img]
[b]Cygnus Autocannon
[/b]This point defence system is designed as a middle-point successor to the venerable Dual Light Machine Guns and the Dual Light Autocannons, it is designed as both a point defence system and a faster firing autocannon that can both obliterate incoming missiles and fighters, as well as smaller ships and their shields.


[img]https://i.imgur.com/G5Qp1aS.png[/img]
[b]Mini Minotaur Cannon
[/b]A smaller caliber, faster firing version of the Minotaur Cannon that can still shred shields and lighter armor and hulls of ships. It might be a less powerful version of the Minotaur Cannon, but it still packs a punch.


[img]https://i.imgur.com/etKFvOD.png[/img]
[b]Minotaur Cannon[/b]
[tr][td]A later Hyperion Systems weapon system design for punching through shields, armor, and hulls, it was designed as a orbital defence weapon system to defend planetary systems from pirates and possibly other invaders.


[img]https://i.imgur.com/XPUyLat.png[/img]
[b]Polaris Projector[/b]
[tr][td]A mass-produced, reversed engineered, less powerful, but cheaper version of the Reality Disruptor from a [REDACTED] found to be drifting near a [REDACTED] in an old Domain-era system. When the Hyperion Systems [REDACTED], they saw the potential of such weapons to be used in the fight against piracy and the Luddic Path, and the potential for trade ships to defend themselves against smaller pirate crafts.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/IQbvlsK.png[/img]
[b]Sagittarius MRM[/b]
[tr][td]Built from the designs of the Harpoon missile after the collapse, this was designed to be the successor of the Harpoon MRM with the capability to deal EMP damage to knock shields out faster.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
