items.name: Kadur Remnant
items.summary: Adds the Kadur Remnant faction as well as several vanilla-friendly ships, weapons, and new starting options.
items.description:
[b][i]god rest the theocrats, c+00 (est.) - c+196.10.17[/i][/b]

[i]Born from the unlikely alliance of two traditionally opposed colonies who banded together during the Collapse to seize their independence from the Domain of Man; the cult-colonies of the Kadur Theocracy were once a great power in the Persean Sector with their own native shipbuilding industry and a powerful spaceborne navy. But now the theocrats are no more -- murdered along with millions of the Kadur people in a brutal conflict which saw the garden world Oasis, the jewel of the Mirage system, seized by the Hegemony and Kadur itself devastated by a Planet Killer-class virus bomb. Now the Kadur Remnant skulk the fringes of the sector in a captured Domain-era orbital fortress and the derelict wreckage of their once-great fleet, fighting a desperate battle for the continued survival of their people.

The faith shared by all Kadur people is still deeply ingrained in every part of their culture, but where the Theocracy was inflexible and hierarchical, the Remnant is decentralized and fluid. Their shared beliefs have grown less dogmatic; focused more now on the connection between individuals forged through mutual hardship, and less on the divine right to power claimed in years past by their religious leaders. The Kadur people remain staunchly independent isolationists, regarding other factions with at best a wary suspicion born from centuries of mutual distrust, but have begun to make some diplomatic connections with other political players in the sector who are hostile to the Hegemony.[/i]

[b]Features:[/b]
[list]
[*]The Kadur Remnant, a remote isolationist faction of refugees and vengeance-seeking holy warriors
[*]Exerelin and Dynasector compatibility
[*]2 new star systems
[*]New ships and weapons for vanilla factions as well as the Kadur themselves
[*]"ship pack only" mode option to disable the Kadur faction and new star systems; only including the vanilla faction ships/weapons
[/list]
[b]Gameplay information:[/b]
The Kadur Theocracy's fleet doctrine was heavily focused on long-range gunline bombardment, faring best when the enemy is kept at arm's length where the Kadur ships can safely catch shots with their otherwise inefficient shields and return fire with their long-range batteries, backing off to vent flux between volleys. However, since the fall of Kadur itself some warriors of the Kadur Remnant have adopted more aggressive tactics, quickly closing the distance to their enemies and overpowering them with close-range firepower before their weak shields and lack of maneuverability can be exploited.
 
Despite sturdy construction and armor, Kadur vessels don't have the durability to stand in the line of fire, and while their focused drive units provide excellent straight-line speed they [i]certainly[/i] don't have the mobility to get themselves out of trouble. They do excel at chasing down fleeing enemies or dashing in to open a gap in enemy lines -- as long as they're careful not to misjudge their opponent's strength and overextend.

[b]A short guide to playing Kadur ships:[/b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/1BzXWRi.jpg[/img]

To summarize:
[b]Faction strengths:[/b]
[list]
[*]High speed
[*]High alpha strike damage
[*]Long-ranged weapons
[*]High hull strength and armor
[*]High mass
[*]Good forward-facing firepower
[/list]
[b]Faction weaknesses:[/b]
[list]
[*]Inefficient and front-fixed shields
[*]Poor maneuverability including acceleration and deceleration
[*]No energy weapons
[*]Mediocre point defense
[*]Mostly support missiles
[*]Exposed engines and few rear-facing weapons
[/list]

v0.13 release notes
- Neoterra changes:
 -- Farming replaced with Hunting & Gathering industry, supplying food and exotic beasts
 -- New commodity, exotic beasts, found exclusively on Neoterra

- Mammoth: Wool patches have been tweaked graphically to clash less with damage and engine flames

items.name: LazyLib
items.summary: LazyLib is a library required by most other Starsector mods.
items.description:
LazyLib is not a regular mod. It doesn't add any ships, weapons or factions. In fact, it doesn't change anything at all in your game! All it does is make writing code for mods easier. It contains methods to deal with otherwise complicated tasks like collision detection and formatted sector messages, among many other things.

Some mods may require LazyLib to run. If you are ever running a mod and get an error along the lines of 'Imported class "org.lazywizard.lazylib.<whatever>" could not be loaded', then this mod is required. Just make sure you have the latest version installed and that it is tagged in the launcher and everything should work.

[b][size=4]Installation Instructions[/size][/b]

This is installed the same way as a normal mod. Simply extract the zip into your mods folder and tag it in the launcher. As this mod does nothing until its classes are called, there is no harm in leaving it tagged in the launcher at all times even if your currently active mods don't require it.

items.name: Legacy of Arkgneisis
items.summary: Adds the Anarakis Reparations Society, a duplicitous quasi nation of privateers flying fragile, angular ships designed to avoid fair fights, and capitalize on unfair ones.
items.description:
[center][b][u][size=5]The Anarakis Reparations Society[/size][/u][/b]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/eug9Jdu.png[/img]﻿

If fragmented and incomplete records are to be believed, the Anarakis Reparations Society was originally little more than a band of anti war protesters dating back to the earliest days of mankind's conquest of space. This notion seems almost disingenuous, as the organization that exists today is made up of some of the least trustworthy people to be found anywhere in the Persean Sector. Filling their coffers with pirated goods for some unknown end, most are advised to avoid the ARS. Most also ignore this warning, seeking to take advantage of their lackadaisical attitude toward trade regulation, or to bribe their aggression in a particular direction. In spite of their reputation, or perhaps because of it, they have carved out a niche in Sector politics as a useful tool for more established powers.

[b][size=4]Ships[/size][/b]
The angular ships flown by the Anarakis Reparations Society are designed to keep their enemies at arms length. With only a handful of notable exceptions, their shields are bad, their armor is bad, and their flux wont hold up in an extended firefight. Instead they rely on quick maneuvers and far reaching fire support, afforded by their lightweight hulls and over-engineered weapon mounts respectively. Caught out of position in a face-to-face brawl, many of their hulls will crumble rapidly.
[size=4]
[b]Weapons[/b][/size]
Considering the state of their ships, it is no surprise that the Anarakis Reparations Society favors medium to long range weapons, and thus fields a plethora of unique equipment which falls into this category. Much like their ships, these implements have no traceable design lineage, and schematics for them are overwhelmingly physical with little to no consideration for Autoforge compliance. This forces them to rely on the Sector's more ubiquitous offerings to ensure their fleets are fully equipped.[/center]

items.summary: An utility mod modifying the vanilla beams to better differentiate them.
items.description:
Ever died to a High Intensity Laser beam that looked just like a much tamer Graviton Beam? Ever got all your weapons disabled because the Ion Beam also look like it? Didn't liked that? Well this is a pretty straightforward utility mini-mod that changes the look of all vanilla beams to better differentiate them. They are now color coded for their damage type rather than exclusively for aesthetic choices. They might seem odd at first, but it will make your life in the sector slightly easier.


[img]http://i.imgur.com/vlQ3oVn.jpg[/img]


   If some of the new colors aren't to your tastes, you can go in the mod's data/weapons folder and simply delete the weapons you want to keep unchanged.

items.name: MagicLib
items.summary: This is a small maintenance update, with a few requested addition from other modders. This is a short "pre-release" to make sure everything new works and I did not break anything else.
items.description:
This is a small maintenance update, with a few requested addition from other modders. This is a short "pre-release" to make sure everything new works and I did not break anything else.

```
 - Added MagicAsteroid plugins to restore functionalities related to asteroids that have been removed in the vanilla game (by SafaryJohn)
     
 - MagicIncompatibleHullmod: now handles hullmods with scripted incompatibilities that have been S-modded by removing the incompatible hullmod added instead of itself. (Thanks to Timid)
     
 - MagicCampaign: CreateFleet now handles fleets that have a spawn location but no assignment target.
     
 - MagicBounty: Hopefuly fixed the log spam after a bounty expired.
```
The goal of MagicLib is to create an Open Source, community driven "library" of useful (and well documented) scripts and plugins that can be leveraged and contributed to by every modder.

Check the Wiki for all the details: <https://starsector.fandom.com/wiki/MagicLib>

**Download:** <https://www.patreon.com/posts/66188070>

**Forum:** <http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13718>
**Nexus:** <https://www.nexusmods.com/starsector/mods/10?tab=files>
**MagicLab discord:** <https://discord.gg/EVQZaD3naU>
**Bug report/feedback:** <https://forms.gle/YbQ8cYUA5QaJBCYV8>

items.name: MagicLib
items.summary: The goal of MagicLib is to create an Open Source, community driven "library" of useful (and well documented) scripts and plugins that can be leveraged and contributed to by every modder.
items.description:
[url=http://starsector.wikia.com/wiki/MagicLib]The functions are fully documented here.[/url]

[url=https://bitbucket.org/CodingTartiflette/magiclib]And you can contribute to the public repository here.[/url]

[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13718]Link to the forum Thread to report issues or suggest additions.[/url]
[size=4]
[/size][size=5][b]Curent content:[/b][/size]

[u][size=4][b]Functions
[/b][/size][/u]
    [b]MagicSettings[/b]
Offers classes to load merged settings and lists from a shared modSettings.json file. Intended to make cross-mod integration and compatibility much easier to manage.

    [b]MagicIncompatibleHullmod[/b]
A uniform solution for the "incompatible hullmod" issue with vanilla hullmods.

    [b]MagicInterference[/b]
Adds a cross-mod mechanic to balance very powerful weapons.

    [b]MagicAnim[/b]
A collection of functions to make smooth animations.

    [b]MagicFakeBeam[/b]
Creates convincing punctual beams from arbitrary coordinates.

    [b]MagicLensFlare[/b]
Creates "cinematic" lens flares.

    [b]MagicRender[/b]
Draw arbitrary sprites on-screen with constraints to entities/camera when needed. (aka "SpriteRenderManager")

    [b]MagicTargeting[/b]
Allows "smart" target selection for systems and missiles within distance and search cone parameters, plus it can use ship-class preferences.

    [b]MagicTrails[/b]
Allows to create missile-style trails anywhere, from ships to bullets, with a lot of customization options. Also includes a CSV based manager
that should be able to handle most projectile use cases with negligible overhead.

    [b]MagicUI[/b]
Draws UI elements such as a system-like charge-bar/tick box next to the normal ship-system for special systems, or an extra status bar above the flux/hull bars.

[u][size=4][b]Loose scripts[/b][/size][/u]
[i]Scripts that can be used "as it is" or can be copied to individual mods to personalize the result.[/i]

    [b]MagicVectorThruster[/b]
Manages vectoring or vernier-style attitude thrusters.

    [b]MagicMissileAI[/b]
A very customizable and lightweight missile AI script usable without any java knowledge.

    [b]MagicGuidedProjectileScript[/b]
A weapon script that allows regular projectiles to track their target.

Also I lack for creativity so please send me names if you think of any lol

_SEE YOU SPACE FEMBOY_

items.name: Missing Ships
items.summary: Adds various ships that i personally feel are missing from the game. Hence the name Missing Ships. Ships are integrated into vanilla factions and are balanced around vanilla ships and normal difficulty.
items.description:
Yo,

felt like some ships were missing from the rooster. Felt like adding them. So i did. currently theres these:

[center]Midline ships
[spoiler]
Dreadnoughts

[b]NAGATO[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/fDc9Kkz.png[/img]
Midline Dreadnought, hulking behemoth of concentrated long range firepower. Utilizing three twin heavy Mjolmir turrets to wrestle with Space Fortresses and planetary ground-to-space batteries (not yet implemented, but it will help with planetary raids), this ship is single-handedly able to destroy whole fleets of capital ships. Designed pre-collapse, but never built, for there was no need for such an expensive ship, new reality of the sector might prove this design to be useful. If anyone is able to find its blueprint and has industrial power to bear, they may as well create this monster of destruction and unleash unseen firepower on the whole galaxy.

[b]PELAGORNIS[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/o7CnRPR.png[/img]
Midline Supercarrier, breaker of worlds. Carrying enough ordinance and support infrastructure to ensure fighter superiority over any theater of war. Able to deploy dozens upon dozens of high end fighters, this mothership can easily overwhelm any and all resistance with ruthless stream of ordinance. Sleek in its design, only very few of these ships were ever build, at the peak of fighter doctrine, to blot out the sun of many worlds. May whatever gods there are have mercy, when this mobile space station arrives on the battlefield. Provides 20 fighter slots and almost 600 ordinance points, battleship level defense capabilities and station level range. note-i used this with only talons. destroyed paragon under a minute, without any other weapons. Named after some prehistoric big bird twat. same as Nagato, player has to build them, no other way of getting them, and i made extra sure that AI wont have access to these ships. however, if given chance, even pop 5 planets with high command can spawn them in fleets, both Nagato and this one.

Capital ships

[b]STAPLE[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/LERSKkV.png[/img]
Midline battleship-uparmored Conquest with 4 centered large ballistic guns. Give it 4 Gauss, extend its range as much as possible and watch it tear enemies to pieces from 2k range-great at taking down shields and has increased PD slots too. Be warned though, its not a very good brawler (flux runs out quick) and it will loose even to Conquest in short/mid range fight due to removal of the prow missile slots. Give it some good escorts or fighter cover. Inspired by Yamato battleship.

[b]ALBATROSS[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/gP6beYu.png[/img]
Midline capital carrier-Conquest that gave up its large guns and prow missiles for 6 wings. it will get shredded by Legion or any other capital in close range due to lack of proper armor and armament, however, it can also dish out serious damage from 8 ballistic slots, 4 on each side able to shoot in front of the ship, but due to flux cost, its highly advised to stay far back and provide overwhelming fighter support. 6 thunders on this baby can ruin day of any Astral and can seriously hinder and even destroy, after prolonged engagement, other capital ships. Inspired by Venator-class from Starwars.

[b]Patrol Boats[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/AtXgK9q.png[/img]
[b]Claymore[/b] is the concept of Midline fighters lead to its extreme. While being technically a fighter, its sheer size and firepower puts it in Patrol Craft size class. This superheavy fighter is equipped with heavy machinegun, vulcan and 6 fighter class Swarmer missiles. Combined with its extreme range, it can give Thunder fighters heavy fire support they often desperately need. Having light frigate armor, Claymore can wrestle with ship PD for quite some time and other than different Patrol Craft, no fighter can challenge its might, but their long refit time should be taken into account when fighting.

[/spoiler]

Lowtech ships
[spoiler]

Capital ships
[b]Expedition[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/ATGAaR6.png[/img]
The peak of exploration technology, building upon heritage of venerable Venture-class Cruiser, Expedition broadens every aspect of it and more. Used as mobile HQ of massive sub-corporations, anchoring entire fleets in deep space, serving as a city, with hospitals, holo-education centers, recreational facilities, enough cargo space to provide independence for up to two years, this ship provides everything a civilian fleet might desire, in their long and lonely expeditions to the fringes of the sector. Has massive array of small weapons providing excellent anti-ordinance capability, 4 fighter bays build with talon fighters in mind, two large ballistic weapon slots for anti-capital duty and sea of ordinance points to give your fleets proper operation center. Not designed or intended to be used in direct combat. Inspired by JMC mining ship, Red Dwarf for early design, then i slapped some vanilla ships onto it and called it a day.-note, might lower flux points, even if all other capitals manage to destroy it, it fares still too good.

Other
[b]Civilian Combat Ships[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/BPtsSqA.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/Om00REI.png[/img]
With the aftermath of the first AI war, millions of traders were disillusioned with the sector powers who were unable to protect them. So various small corporations and civilian concerns came up with conversion kits for many ships. Most widely used were the Light Carrier [b]Buffalo Mk.III[/b] kit and Destroyer [b]Nyx[/b] kit.Buffalo Mk.III can house two wings of fighters without any issue, however, much like Buffalo freighter, it has lackluster armor and armament to defend itself, so its rather regarded as Wing Tender, rather than Carrier. Nyx on the other hand sports heavy armor even for its weight class, and able to be uparmored to cruiser class armor. It also has several weapon mounts able to cover its own bases against ordinance and enemy ships alike. Nyx fulfills the so much needed "ship of the line" role, that so few civilian ships can take.

[b]Patrol Craft[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/VYZoy3z.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/v5TRzPT.png[/img]
Ubiquitous on planets of the leading powers, the "PC" or "Patrol Craft" serve generally only as suppression and heavy patrol units, however, after slight modifications to its engine systems, these Patrol Craft can be used in space combat without much issue. They can fit into most hangars, and while they have very high supply profile, they provide serious firepower for a "fighter" class ship, rocking mostly about half of what Frigate class ships carry.
Two main classes which both have two sub classes are [b]Patrol Craft class[/b] and [b]Gun Craft class[/b]. Patrol craft subclasses are [b]Patrol Craft[/b], with twin auto cannon, two twin machineguns and vulcan on its rear, and [b]Torpedo Craft[/b] with twin auto cannon, two single harpoon launchers and rear vulcan. [b]Gun Craft[/b] subclasses are [b]Gun Craft[/b] with twin auto cannon, heavy machinegun and rear vulcan and [b]Flak Craft[/b] with twin auto cannon, single flak gun and rear vulcan.
patrol craft gun craft

[b]Fighter wings[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/lCTDvrh.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/mqHqYmC.png[/img]
First new addition, [b]Nail[/b], represents soul of the sector. Utilitarian application of stripping every single thing from ships, making them horrible death traps for sake of saving money and limited space. While loosing its missile pods and targeting systems, wing of Nails gains 2 additional fighters over its more conventional death trap, Talon. Being basically Vulcan with engine and poor soul piloting it, its good anti-ordinance fighter, and still somewhat capable anti-fighter fighter, but other than that, its pretty useless. But then again, what else that came from the pirate yards isnt. Second addition is [b]Broadsword Mk.II[/b]. Upon closer inspection of Broadsword, it was found that it actually carries two missile spots, but no missiles. Big brain geniuses in Hegemon Naval yards figured they could utilize sudden surge of fighter size missile pods and weld them to these spots. And so was born the Broadsword Mk.II. boosting original machineguns and two missile pods, it became strong contender for the best fighter in the sector. Only question remains, how noone figured out this sooner.

[/spoiler]

Hegemony ships
[spoiler]
Other
[b]Second Generation Hegemony Auxiliaries[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/rvA7wRF.png[/img][url=https://imgur.com/wAItPqB][img]http://i.imgur.com/wAItPqB.png[/img][/url][img]https://i.imgur.com/2DOZ8P9.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/jHo0fq0.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/C54Yevg.png[/img]
5 more civilian ships converted by the Hegemony Naval yards in effort to bolster the ever weakening ranks of the Hegemon flotilla. First new ship is modified [b]Colossus-class Freighter[/b], which is supposed to replace fragile Buffalo-class Freighters, which fall an easy prey to increasing pirate activity. Second addition is modified [b]Condor-class Light Carrier[/b], while it was already ambiguous across the Hegemon fleets, it never received the attention it deserved. It got it now, with upgrades across the board making it even more formidable carrier than before. Third ship is a surprising addition, [b]Mudskipper-class Wing Carrier[/b], originally used as a small transport ship, its shuttle bay was modified to house wing of talon fighters. While there wasnt any space left for proper shield generator, it still provides cheapest way to get fighter capability to any fleet desperate enough to use it. Fourth addition is another Hegemon evergreen, the famous [b]Mule-class Combat Freighter[/b]. Featuring already thick armor and serious armament for a freighter, military upgrades only benefited this formidable ship. Last but not least, [b]Venture-class Cruiser[/b], another ship everpresent in the sector. By several simple upgrades, Hegemon Venture now poses serious threat to any captain foolish enough to underestimate the venerable Venture. Stripping away its mining drones and survey equipment and modernizing the fighter bay to house a talon wing, this ship has reached new potential, waiting to be exploited.

[/spoiler]

Luddic Path
[spoiler]

Dreadnought
[b]RAGNAROK[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/981Rvcz.png[/img]
Hammer of Ludd. Avatar of his holy spirit, the [b]Ragnarok[/b], what once was a life giver to the Persean sector is now its ultimate demise. Old Sporeship, one of the first to arrive to the sector, hundreds of years old was reforged, remade and refitted with Space Fortress worth of armaments. This mobile battle station, able to smash through capital ships is the peak of Luddic Paths efforts to eradicate the sector of the heretics and heathens. May Ludd has mercy on anyone foolish enough to fight this instrument of his holy will.

Other

[b]Cruisers[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/oqtEPH2.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/a4zPWAM.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/OYSgOkl.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/DWkBelB.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/lxbPxBJ.png[/img]
Much like its pirate brethen, even Luddic Path saw the possible utility of the Starliner. Haphazardly converting it to the carrier brings much needed fighter support to the Panther fleets. [b]Starliner Mk.III[/b] houses 3 wings of fighters, and while its support infrastructure is nothing great, its still remarkably useful, and whats more important to the Panthers, cheap. While Starliner is readily available, other cruiser class ships arent. Panthers however desperately needed cruiser combat ships. Opportunity appeared however. Everpresent husks and hulks of the abandoned and destroyed ships are all around the sector. And so was born the Panther combat fleet. Consisting mostly out of previously destroyed and looted ships, while not being even remotely as efficient as their new and pristine counterparts, these ships are everywhere, have low support profile and are cheap to maintain. For cruiser class, these ships are [b]Eagle[/b], [b]Dominator[/b], [b]Falcon[/b] and [b]Venture[/b]. Every looted ship had its energy weapons removed and retrofitted to ballistic weapons, due to their lower cost and availability. Because of their salvaged nature, they are worse in every single aspect than their counterparts. However, they have reduced supply and deployment requirements, making them great at overwhelming enemies with numbers.


[b]Destroyers[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/N3eqMyN.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/wCb0bnW.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/SRw77c1.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/zKr7kQI.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/UYzWM6R.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/uCbsZLs.png[/img]
Along with construction its main cruiser fleets, Panthers realized they needed screen ships too. First of these is [b]Condor[/b]. Classic civilian and military light carrier, only proper carrier in the Panther lineup. Then comes the combat destroyers. Same as with their cruiser counterparts, these are mostly looted and salvaged ships, making them overall worse, but cheaper to maintain and deploy. [b]Enforcer[/b] and [b]Hammerhead[/b] pose great threat to merchant fleets, due to their overhaulet engine systems, giving them ability to quickly close in in their targets. During raids, Panthers get a lot of various freighters. Realizing the boon on their hands, they converted [b]Tarsus[/b] and [b]Mule[/b] freighters into makeshift combat ships. While far from any actual combat ships, they still pose a threat to civilian vessels. Last but not least, [b]Nebula[/b]. Same with Starliner, Luddic Path found them self with massive fleet of these looted ships after countless raids. Rather than selling them or scrapping them, they repurposed it, and made deadly Hammer barrage its main weapon, converting its standard hangar to house Hammer torpedoes, giving it quite a few volleys before running out.

[b]Frigates[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/Vsq1eSK.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/Ddxciyc.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/z52JmBX.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/iK3S9gb.png[/img]
Much like with previous classes, even frigates were needed, and so panthers came up with additional designs for their fleets. [b]Wolf[/b], while loosing its jump abilities, is still a formidable and very nimble frigate. Other 3 frigates are converted civilian ships. The [b]Mercury[/b], [b]Hermes[/b] and [b]Mudskipper[/b]. Mercury and Hermes were merely armed with two missile slots. Muddskipper, however, following its pirate counterpart, has been fitted with Hammer barrage. While extremely fragile, one would be fool to underestimate raw killing power of this small craft equal to suicide bomber.

[b]Patrol Craft[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/R04oPcV.png[/img]
[b]Snake[/b] is an old mining craft design, carrying two hammer torpedoes and two small guns for protection, it was often used during small scale mining operations. While rather weak, its the better alternative to the Perdition bombers, which far too often fall prey to enemy PD.

[/spoiler]

Pirates
[spoiler]

Capital ships
[b]ATLAS MK.III[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/hF9sFkr.png[/img]
Albatross but everything is wrong. Using broken down Atlas Mk.II as its basis, stripped most weapon mounts and welded massive fighter bay where cargo bay once stood. While still suffering from lack luster generator, slow speed and paper thin armor, it can deliver 6 fighter wings of ordinance in relatively cheap package (and a littlecorrupted too). There were some spontaneous combustion incidents from subpar quality fighters, but such sacrifice is pirate captain always willing to make. Inspired by Colossus Mk.III.

Other
[b]Pirate Fleet Extended[/b]
[img]https://i.imgur.com/u0WdAPE.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/E8ZtVuy.png[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/4fDbt06.png[/img]
While Hegemony pushed "new" designs into the sector, pirates took some inspiration, and a nanoforge or two, or much more likely just stole some welding torches, and made some "new" ships of their own as well. First being pirate modification of [b]Venture Cruiser[/b], nothing exceptional, except that it has lost all of its more delicate equipment "somewhere". Good ship of the line, and when supported by another two new additions to the pirate fleet, it is rather dangerous. [b]Starliner[/b], unused, sat around the sector as bleak reminder of the golden age. It now serves a much more practical purpose. Filled to the brim with massive computers, communications arrays and wide array of amenities to serve its pirate crew, this ship can seriously bolster any fleet it supports. [b]Nebula[/b], while being yet another reminder of bygone era, served well in the new daily reality of the sector, however, when pirate warlords were done with the starliner support ship design, they still desired something more nimble, smaller. And so came the Nebula Mk.II into being.
note:i dont know how OP will be the new starliner/nebula builds. They will have immense effect on larger fleets, but as i dont really have time to play for few dozen hours with these, i will rely on you, the people, to let me know if its OP or UP.

[/spoiler]



[/center]



Furthermore, i will likely continue to add ships to the game, until my inevitable burnout.

[b]Planned ships are:[/b]

[b]Pirate versions of vanilla ships[/b] - underutilized designs will find their way into the game, one way or another-some added in 0.3
[b]"Atlas salvage rig"[/b] - Atlas but salvage rig.
[b]More Auxiliary ships[/b] - hegemony and other factions will get more/their own auxiliary ships, following same philosophy as vanilla "(A)", -note, few hegemon ships added in 0.2.1
[b]Civilian combat oriented ships[/b] - made as part of my other mod, not yet public, in effort to prolong midgame-some added in 0.3
[b]Dreadnought class[/b] of ships for low/mid/high tech and pirates-only 1 per campaign, not buildable, only scavengable. balance wise-about 1 space station section. (this will take significantly longer time to reach, since it will be harder to just recycle assets from vanilla and i cant draw for ****)

------

I am open to suggestions about new ships/balance of current ships. Staple and Albatross took me like a day to make with reading modding tutorials included, so i guess i could add ships relatively fast.

LIST OF SUGGESTIONS:
expedition is *** ugly and i will make proper model once i think of something prettier than Rimmers forehead.
note-description ingame is unfinished and really not the top priority for me, if someone is willing to make vanilla sized descriptions for ships, i will marry your dog.
------
CREDITS:
Nautilus81-DESCRIPTION OF SHIPS:Staple, Albatross, Atlas Mk.III,Patrol Craft,Expedition,Buffalo Mk.III,Nyx
Archaeon-DESCRIPTION OF SHIPS:Broadsword Mk.II, Colossus, Condor, Mudskipper, Mule, Nagato, Nail, Nebula Mk.II, Starliner Mk.II, Venture, Pirate Venture
------

CHANGELOG[spoiler]
0.4.-25.11.2019-Ludd Path update, hella path ships, modified weight values so path would use exclusively path ships (ships that were blessed by the ludd, so they can use the fuel "luciferium") and added midline superheavy fighter and several small corrections on other ships and made new mod page layout.
0.3.4.-08.11.2019-Bunch of minor balance tweaks, added missile slots to mule, added supercarrier Pelagornis. bunch of other changes i forgot. Made sure so that AI wont be able to use super ships.
0.3.3 hotfix1-29.10.2019-nagato wasnt attacked by enemies, for some reason. fixed
0.3.3.-26.10.2019-Introduced Nagato, Nail and broadsword Mk.II. Several corrections and balance changes applied. NAGATO CAN BE ONLY BUILD FROM BLUEPRINT FROM THIS VERSION UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE. Added few descriptions
0.3.2.-15.10.2019-balance update mostly. fixed pirate starliner and made ventures less beefy-hegemony venture could reach 2400 armor easily. that wont do.
0.3.1.hotfix1-09.10.2019-pirate venture had bugged collision detection, remade it, works in my game. renamed starliner and nebula roles.
0.3.1.-08.10.2019:fixed starliner and nebula clasification, upped maintenance and fleet points of albatross, made pirate venture more combat oriented and changed its built in hangar into converted hangar bay
0.3.-07.10.2019:Added pirate ships:Venture, starliner support and nebula support. Added civilian ships:Nyx destroyer and Buffalo wing tender. Added Patrol Craft
0.2.2.-26.9.2019:made few graphical improvements on ships, made OP adjustments for few ships, removed two medium energy slots from albatross, fixed expedition, no longer frigate but capital.
0.2.1.hotfix1-26.09.2019:Expedition spawns within 4 factions, with independents being main sellers. i dont know what was wrong, i just rewrote half of the data and somehow it worked. ship was ingame and working, but for some reason wasnt recognized by markets.
0.2.1-31.8.2019:added Expedition and several Hegemony auxiliaries. Upped auxiliary use by hegemony by 0.5.
0.2-20.8.2019:added Atlas Mk.III, made factions use new ships/made ships actually buyable
0.1-18.8.2019:RELEASE[/spoiler]

items.name: Mnemonic Sensors 0.2.0
items.summary: A utility mod that equips your sensors with a sensor signature memory bank. Can be added to/removed from an ongoing campaign.
items.description:
A utility mod that equips your sensors with a sensor signature memory bank. Can be added to/removed from an ongoing campaign.

When a previously encountered object appears as a sensor signature, it will be surrounded by a circle.
That way, you can easily tell if a sensor blip is just some metal you dumped previously or juicy loot.

Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/mnemonic-sensors/releases
Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25328.msg376567#msg376567

Please let me know if you encounter any issues.

Requires Lazylib.

0.1.1: fixed issue with circles popping up while GUIs were open, made circles prettier
0.2.0: color coding

items.name: Mod Deconflictor
items.summary: Allows select mods to to work together.
items.description:
Removes artificial incompatibility between HTE and Aria.

The author of HTE checks to see if the plugins are loadable for both of those mods and if they are will crash your Starsector. This mod is a java agent that loads before Starsector does anything else and intercepts HTE's method calls and replaces them with something else.

Uploaded here are the following:
[list]
[*]Files to drop into Starsector/starsector-core
[/list][list=1]
[*]agent.jar
[*]byte-buddy-1.10.20.jar
[*]starsector.bat
[/list][list]
[*]An eclipse project with the source so someone else can build this themselves
[/list][list=1]
[*]Includes an ant build.xml and build.properties that automates the build and deployment
[/list]
Once you drop the files into starsector-core you want to run starsector.bat. The security manager in Starsector disables attaching an agent at runtime the easy way so it needs to be defined in the startup options.

Essentially that bat file has [b]-javaagent:agent.jar[/b] added before the classpath and  [b]-classpath byte-buddy-1.10.20.jar[/b] the bytebuddy jar added to the front of the classpath. You can make these changes to your vmparams file if you prefer to use the exe.

This is released under the MIT license, go wild. Bytebuddy is Apache2.0 licensed.

Had to change the .bat file to a .txt since that just red flags the upload.

items.name: More Planetary Conditions
items.summary: Adds a number of custom planetary conditions, each with their own unique mechanics, scripting, and behavior, that hopefully set them apart from everything else.
items.description:
Adds a number of custom planetary conditions, each with their own unique mechanics, scripting, and behavior, that hopefully set them apart from everything else.

Tested to a good extent, although there are still reports of strange gamebreaking bugs, albiet very rare and unreplicable. I'd say it's safe to use, but be cautious.

Probably not safe to put in a existing save. I mean, it won't even generate the conditions.

```
Changelog

1.0.5a

LIKELY SAVE COMPATABLE

Fixes up a few things from the last updates and polishes it
```
If you want to quickly experience the satellites, make a new game and run FindPlanetsWithConditionId niko_MPC_antiAsteroidSatellites , then go to a provided location.

items.name: More Ship Names
items.summary:
More Ship Names adds 7,500 thematically-appropriate ship names to the naming pool for ships to (randomly) select from.
(6,032 names for conventional ships, and 968 + 500 for REDACTED ships.)

If you're tired of every other ship being named 'Einstein's Demon' or 'To Goddard With Apologies', then this tiny mod is for you!
items.description:
[b][color=#6fa8dc]More Ship Names[/color][/b] adds [b]7,500[/b] thematically-appropriate ship names to the naming pool for ships to (randomly) select from. 
[color=#999999](6,032 names for conventional ships, and 968 + 500 for REDACTED ships.)
[/color]
These include:

[list]
[*]1,750 names to the GENERAL pool (mostly [color=#d8d8d8]Independent [/color]and[color=#d8d8d8] [/color][color=#fff2cc]Persean League[/color])
[*]470 names to the SPACE pool
[*]1,550 names to the PIRATES pool
[*]360 names to the MERCANTILE pool (mostly [color=#fff2cc]Persean League[/color])
[*]470 names to the LUDDIC CHURCH pool
[*]460 names to the BEASTS pool (mostly [color=#ea9999]Pirates[/color])
[*]435 names to the BRITISH NAVY pool (mostly [color=#f4cccc]Hegemony[/color])
[*]387 names to the JAPANESE pool (mostly [color=#cfe2f3]Tri-Tachyon[/color])
[*]150 names to the PERSIAN pool
[*]968 names to the REDACTED pool
[*]500 names to the OTHER REDACTED pool
[/list]
Names have been chosen from various media including (but not limited to) song titles, science-fiction and fantasy book and short story titles, stories from pulp science-fiction magazines, spacecraft from the Culture series, ship names from the Halo series, British naval vessels (past and present), Japanese naval vessels (past and present), poetry (titles and specific lines), hymns, idioms, and scientific terminology, among other sources.

REDACTED names are a combination of Greek and Hebrew alphabet letters plus a title of royalty [color=#999999](there are only 49 of them in vanilla)[/color].
OTHER REDACTED names are six-digit hex codes [color=#999999](the same as vanilla, of which there are only 25)[/color].

If you're tired of seeing ships called [i][color=#d9d2e9]Einstein's Demon[/color][/i] and [i][color=#fff2cc]To Goddard With Apologies[/color][/i], this mod is for you.


﻿
Examples of ship names include:

[color=#cfe2f3]GENERAL:[/color] [i]Against The Fall Of Night, Bipolar Nightmare, Carry On Wayward Son, Dances On The Snow, Encounter In The Dawn, Fate Amenable To Change[/i]
[color=#c9daf8]
SPACE:[/color] [i]Across The Sea Of Suns, Beyond The Black, Cataclysmic Variable, Distant Retrograde, Eclipsing Binary, Five Against Venus
[/i][color=#ea9999]
PIRATE:[/color] [i]A Momentary Lapse Of Sanity, Be Quick Or Be Dead, Caught Red Handed, Death Is A Lonely Business, Eight Rounds Rapid, Frustrated Palm Tree[/i]
[color=#d9d2e9]
MERCANTILE:[/color] [i]Any Colour You Like, Business As Usual, City Upon A Hill, Damning With Faint Praise, Economical With The Truth, For Your Consideration[/i]
[color=#d9ead3]
LUDDIC CHURCH:[/color] [i]Acts Of Sacrifice, Banality Of Evil, Children Of Tomorrow, Descent Of Angels, Echoes Of Revelation, Faltering Prayer[/i]
[color=#dbb0a7]
BEASTS:[/color] [i]Aethon, [/i][i]Bakonawa, [/i][i]Caladrius, [/i][i]Domovoi, [/i][i]Erymanthian, Fenghuang[/i]

[color=#fce5cd]BRITISH NAVY:[/color] [i]Acheron, Bonaventure, Cormorant, Enchantress, Fervent[/i]

[color=#cfe2f3]JAPANESE:[/color] [i]Akatsuki, Chikuma, Fubuki, Hamakaze, Izumi, Kusunoki, Matsushima[/i]

[color=#fff2cc]PERSIAN:[/color] [i]Ahriman, Bushyasta, Drvaspa, Fravashi, Khvarenah[/i]

[color=#9fc5e8]REDACTED:[/color] [i]Alpha-Baron, [/i][i]Beta-Duchess, [/i][i]Chi-Gōng, [/i][i]Delta-Knight, Epsilon-Rex

[/i][color=#ffe599]OTHER REDACTED:[/color] [i]0086d0, 02d5d7, 030997, 04026f, 052243[/i]

[b][color=#fce5cd]

Note:[/color][/b] If you would like [color=#b6d7a8]LUDDIC PATH[/color] ships to also use [color=#d9ead3]LUDDIC CHURCH[/color] names, and [color=#d8d8d8]Independent[/color] ships to use more SPACE and MERCANTILE names, there is also an optional folder that will allow those factions to expand their pool of names.

Just move the [color=#ead1dc]data[/color] folder from the[color=#d9d2e9] optional[/color] folder into the [color=#cfe2f3]root[/color] More Ship Names folder.

items.name: Nexerelin
items.summary: Nexerelin adds a number of 4X gameplay features to Starsector, such as faction diplomacy and warfare, and enhances the game with several other features. Choose your faction (or establish your own) and dominate the Sector!
items.description:
[b][u]Features[/u][/b]
[list]
[*]4X game features in Starsector
[list]
[*]Factions will [b]wage war[/b] against each other and try to conquer their enemies
[*][b]Diplomacy[/b] events see faction relationships changing over time
[*][b]Join a faction[/b] to gain useful support and represent them in war and peace, or start your own
[*][b]Alliances[/b] offer mutual assistance in times of war
[*]Employers pay [b]insurance[/b] for ship losses
[*]NPC colonies [b]grow[/b] over time
[*]Planet descriptions can change as territory is won and lost (in development)
[/list][*]More things to do
[list]
[*][b]Mine[/b] planets and asteroids for useful resources for trade, or some treasure
[*]Use [b]agents[/b] to subvert other factions to your own ends
[*]Requisition [b]fleets[/b] from your colonies to carry out tasks
[*]Pay [b]tribute[/b] for the right to infringe on factions' territory
[*]Bring [b]aid[/b] to troubled worlds to keep them from decivilization
[*]Turn in [b]prisoners[/b] for reputation or cash
[*]Browse the [b]Prism Freeport[/b] for rare and pricey ships
[*]Construct remote [b]outposts[/b] to aid exploration
[/list][*]More events
[list]
[*][b]Remnant[/b] raids
[*][b]Relief[/b] fleets
[*][b]Vengeance[/b] fleets
[/list][*]New starting options
[list]
[*]Play in a [b]randomly generated[/b] Sector, or travel the star systems seen in vanilla and other mods
[*]Begin your journey with a range of [b]starting factions and ships[/b]
[/list][*]Gameplay tweaks
[list]
[*]Befriend pirates to lower the effects of their activity on your colonies
[*]Lower tariffs on trade
[*]...and more enhancements
[/list][/list]

items.name: Out of Place Characters - Portrait Conversion
Outer Rim Alliance
items.summary: "We help the poor, lift the desperate, mend the broken, and together, we build a better future."
items.description:
[center]﻿[img]http://i.imgur.com/3F2EkQB.jpg[/img][/center]


﻿[i]Welcome to the Outer Rim Alliance, a growing force of good in these dire times. One of the few groups, if not the only one, able to reverse the spiral of destruction that plagued our Sector since the Great Collapse. Let go of your worldly possessions, give them to the Alliance and we will give you a purpose. Become an agent of reconstruction rather than destruction, and strive to build a better world, together.[/i]


[center][youtube]Kwdl-jQkyTs[/youtube][/center]


[i][u][size=4]GAMEPLAY[/size][/u][/i]


﻿This is a high-tech faction almost entirely composed of broadside ships. As high tech ships, they mostly rely on energy weapons with a few missiles sprinkled here and there. They favor deliberate tactics, using their numerous weapon emplacements to pumel their enemies with long range artillery fire. Slow by nature, they usually rely on dense formations of cruisers with heavy fighter support to keep the enemy at range. While not the flashiest, those ships are reliable and dependable.

On the campaign layer, the Outer Rim Alliance occupy a large cluster of systems with a solid industrial base and a rich history to explore.


[i][u][size=4]CONTENT SHOWCASE[/size][/u][/i]


[img]https://i.imgur.com/8gFduzj.png[/img]


[center]Alternate skin packs
[spoiler]

[/spoiler][/center]
[center]﻿[size=3][i][u]Bug Tracker and Feedback form[/u][/i]:[/size]
You have some feedback to share and want to make sure I do not miss it? You can use [url=https://forms.gle/YbQ8cYUA5QaJBCYV8]this google form[/url] to leave me a comment.

items.name: Quality Captains
items.summary:
A gameplay-first, balance friendly, fully configurable skill overhaul. ~~Now with more cursed easter eggs.~~
Compared to vanilla, skills have more even value, stronger roles, and more flexibility. Fleet point effects have been removed, new (and old) effects have been added, and several skills have received all-new dynamic constraints.
items.description:
A gameplay-first, balance friendly, fully configurable skill overhaul. ~~Now with more cursed easter eggs.~~
Compared to vanilla, skills have more even value, stronger roles, and more flexibility. Fleet point effects have been removed, new (and old) effects have been added, and several skills have received all-new dynamic constraints. 
Also includes a thorough and fully customizable ECM and Navigation overhaul.
Save friendly, can be added and removed in ongoing games. 
```1.1.0 - Full 0.95.1a release. 
- Users from the release candidates will want to update for tweaks, polish, and a full review of default armor bonuses.
1.1.1
- Changed the behavior of the ECM skill to count each electronic warfare skill toward ECM score rather than just checking that you have at least 1. 
- Corrected an error in the description of Point Defense that was displaying half the configured value for anti-fighter damage.
- Various fixes to the Automated Ships skill. It should now display and act exactly as configured.
- Restored Bulk Transport's civilian ship burn bonus and added the corresponding config. 
111h
- Removed a duplicate Hypercognition skill. Will probably require no AI Governors or a new game. No urgent changes.
```

items.name: Ramscoop
items.summary: If you happen to be out scouting the sector and are getting low on fuel, just fly through the nearest nebula and top up your tanks! Now with supplies!
items.description:
This mod makes it so if you fly through a nebula and don't have a full fuel tank, your fleet will automatically suck up the free-floating gases and material of the nebula and generate fuel straight into your tanks without having to worry about turning anything on or using up something else. With 0.2, you can also generate supplies too and the config will let you adjust gen rates as you like.

No hullmods, no activated skills, and (hopefully) nothing baked into your saves so adding/removing this mod at any time should be easy.

Just extract into your mods folder, turn on in the launcher and enjoy.

Default settings are set to using excess crew over fleet minimum to create supplies so if you're out exploring and create a colony, your capacity to produce supplies WILL drop.

items.name: Rebalanced Doom
items.summary: A minimod that changes the Doom to be less oppressive while maintaining its identity.
items.description:
A minimod that changes the Doom to be less oppressive while maintaining its identity.

Active changes:
- Removes the ability to deploy mines while phasing.
- Reduces the range of the mine strike system from 1500 to 800.

Goal of the mod:
- Make the Doom less annoying to play against and less overpowered to play as.
- Make it harder and riskier to use well.
- Keep its core identity as a backstabbing ship intact.
- Make sure that the AI is able to use the changed ship well.
- Do it with as few changes as possible.

Forum thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21607.0

items.name: Red Hyperspace - "How did I forget about slipstreams" Update
items.summary: -Thank you Citizen Joe, for reminding me that slipstreams exist.
items.description:
-Thank you Citizen Joe, for reminding me that slipstreams exist.

*Hyperspace is a vital tool to us, a means of communication and transport. Without it, there would be no Domain of Man, for there would be no quick bridges between the stars. We use it, and we harness it, but we have no absolute control over it. It is a wild thing that tolerates our presence, but brooks no mastery. There is power in hyperspace, fundamental power, not good, nor evil, but elemental and anathema to us. It is a tool we use at our own risk.*

items.name: Remnant Command Transfer
items.summary: Does exactly what it says on the tin. This lets you transfer command to your remnant ships in combat. It doesn't remove the requirement for AI core officers, or allow you to set automated ships as flagship, since they require the AI officer.
items.description:
Does exactly what it says on the tin. This lets you transfer command to your remnant ships in combat. It doesn't remove the requirement for AI core officers, or allow you to set automated ships as flagship, since they require the AI officer.

Please note that integrating an AI core will still block command transfer. That's handled by (non-moddable) core code.

Save compatible- can be added or removed mid-save with no issues.

items.name: Scy
items.summary: Blood-thirsty pirates for some, ruthless slavers for others, treacherous spies for the rest... The Sector is a tough place to live in, and like many others the Scyan people have been forced to compromise their principles in order to survive.
items.description:
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/gNzbvcT.jpg[/img][/center]


﻿[i]The Scy Nation literally emerged from the ashes of the ""Science Colony of Yggdrasill"". Before the Collapse, the S.C.o.Y. was a nomadic colony built inside an asteroid to travel the stars and study the universe one system at a time. When the Great Collapse occurred and the gate system shutdown the colony became trapped in the Sector, its inhabitants found themselves at the unfortunate center of attention of the Tri-Tachyon Corporation, the Hegemony and the Luddic Church, all eager to get their hands on Yggdrasill's mini-autofactory and its intact pre-collapse UAC library. Using the gigantic ship as a Cryo-arch, two thirds of the population would escape the crossfire while the rest were put to the stake by Ludd fanatics for worshipping the "demonic autofactory".

﻿They tried to rebuild their life in a remote system, away from the core worlds Collapse, but circomstances always seems to pull them back, always forcing them[/i][i] to take further extremes measures to ensure their survival.
[/i]


[center][youtube]0-ooC-pgCFI[/youtube][/center]


﻿This faction mixes all techs in a melting pot of advanced engineering craziness, producing ships and weapons unlike any others. It features ships with modular armor, teleporting guns, phase missiles, laser torpedoes, all sorts of miniguns and more.


[i][u][size=4]GAMEPLAY[/size][/u][/i]


﻿Skirmisher to the core, Scyan ships have a [i]deep[/i] flux pool to make the most out of an hit-run, and slightly better speed to manage to disengage. On the other hand they have slightly more fragile hulls, narrow shields, terrible flux dissipation (relying on venting instead) and fewer weapon mounts. They have to rely on wolf pack tactics to kill isolated targets while the bigger enemies are tied up pursuing smaller prey. Their weapons usually have worse range than vanilla one but superior damage, making even the smallest ship a potential threat if left completely unchecked. When pursued however, they can fold very quickly due to their exposed sides and low staying power.


[i][u][size=4]CONTENT SHOWCASE[/size][/u][/i]

[spoiler][img]https://i.imgur.com/d8SRBYG.jpg[/img][/spoiler]

[spoiler][img]https://i.imgur.com/zY39I6F.jpg[/img][/spoiler]

[center][size=3][i][u]Bug Tracker and Feedback form[/u][/i]:[/size]
You have some feedback to share and want to make sure I do not miss it? You can use [url=https://forms.gle/YbQ8cYUA5QaJBCYV8]this google form[/url] to leave me a comment.


This mod is quite packed with content. When used with other large mods you may need to allocate additional memory.
Visit the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=10931.0]Modding troubleshooting guide[/url] on the official forum for guidance, or join the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=11488.0]Unofficial Discord server[/url].


Big thanks to all the modders that helped to create this mod:
[i]Cycerin, Debido, Mesotronik, Dark Revenant, Silentstormpt,
Histidine, SniZupGun, Deathfly, 19_30, and many others.[/i]

Music by [url=https://soundcloud.com/fastland][u]Cycerin[/u][/url]


You like the mod? Help to make it better: Donations will be used to commission content I cannot create myself, such as illustrations or
music. Additionally, if you would enjoy playing with a custom paint job I
also take commissions for a reasonable rate. PM me for more details on
the Forum or Discord.

items.name: Seeker - Unknown Contact
items.summary: Venturing in the dark outreaches of the Persean Sector is a pathway to salvaging ships with many abilities, some considered to be unnatural.
items.description:
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/W4XZyF7.jpg[/img][/center]

 This ship pack provides a wide selection of more than 30 vessels that do not exactly match existing vanilla aesthetic or gameplay styles. They range from the uncommon and unconventional class to some properly rare (and expensive to deploy) super-ships. Still, everything should be balanced with proper strengths and weaknesses; including some new balancing levers such as exotic weapons interfering with each other, to avoid any power creep.

 The intent here is to offer enough different "white whales" that you are both guaranteed to encounter several of them in any given run, yet each would be rare enough that you won't be able to collect them all in a single play-through. If you are using Nexerelin however, you will be able to start directly with some of the uncommon ships. I would even advise trying some of the very enjoyable "player-bait" destroyer starts.

Small sample of the ships you might encounter:
[spoiler][center][center][img]https://i.imgur.com/iUEhFCw.png[/img][/center][b]Hedone-class armed yacht[/b]

Gustav Royal Starworks' best selling premium yacht, ideal for the affluent needing to travel in comfort and security.

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/8P1PEFo.png[/img][/center][b]Aethernium-class militarized racer[/b]

Fast and economical courier that never walks away from a fair fight.

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/DlaUV3b.png[/img][/center][b]Butterfly-class private security destroyer[/b]

Makes up for its lack of versatility with raw frontal firepower.

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/gPQMOS9.png[/img][/center][b]Five-five-seven-class bounty-hunter destroyer[/b]

Flashy coat of paint, big gun that makes a big noise, daredevil attitude, badass in every way.

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/kjBYejl.png[/img][/center][b]Obelisk-class luxury liner[/b]

Guaranteed to impress your guests somehow, either with its ostentatious design and facilities, or with its massive gun.

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/x2O8sFZ.png[/img][/center][b]Tumbleweed-class explorer[/b]

Jack of all trades, master of none...

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/30Vf2JC.png[/img][/center][b]Bullhorn-vlass heavy cruiser[/b]

Slightly more agile and versatile than a Dominator-class, even more vulnerable to the rear.

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/GKaid06.png[/img][/center][b]Cassowary-class support battlecruiser[/b]

The true nemesis of captains with OCD.[/center]
[/spoiler]


[center]﻿[size=3][i][u]Bug Tracker and Feedback form[/u][/i]:[/size]
You have some feedback to share and want to make sure I do not miss it? You can use [url=https://forms.gle/YbQ8cYUA5QaJBCYV8]this google form[/url] to leave me a comment.


This mod is quite packed with content. When used with other large mods you may need to allocate additional memory.
Visit the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=10931.0]Modding troubleshooting guide[/url] on the official forum for guidance, or join the [url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=11488.0]Unofficial Discord server[/url].


You like the mod? Help to make it better: Donations will be used to commission content I cannot create myself, such as illustrations or music. Additionally, if you would enjoy playing with a custom paint job I also take commissions for a reasonable rate. PM me for more details on the Forum or Discord.

items.summary: *No more relying on modders creating a showcase mission for you!*
items.description:
*No more relying on modders creating a showcase mission for you!*

Provides four main menu missions:
-one for all the ships in vanilla
-one for all the ships added by mods filtered on a per-mod basis
-one that allows custom searches through editing a CSV file
-one for mod makers that lists variants with some common issues

- Ship filters to avoid spoilers
- Weapon/wing filters so you can also look at only the relevant mod gear (or mod gear + vanilla (or [REDACTED]^2 weapons))
- Perma-modding s/d-mods in case you want to try out some builds without loading the campaign and doing a bunch of console commands
- Testing officer abilities in sim

items.name: Simple Skill Tweaks 1.0
items.summary: Makes very simple tweaks to some skills that my addled brain came up with. Part QoL, part 'immersion', part nerf. Any undesired changes to a skill can be reverted at any time by deleting the relevant .skill file in Simple Skill Tweaks>data>characters>skills. **Please see the readme.txt inside for the exact changes** and inane reasoning.
items.description:
Makes very simple tweaks to some skills that my addled brain came up with. Part QoL, part 'immersion', part nerf. Any undesired changes to a skill can be reverted at any time by deleting the relevant .skill file in Simple Skill Tweaks>data>characters>skills. **Please see the readme.txt inside for the exact changes** and inane reasoning.

Hope you get some use out of this, and feel free to @ me if you have any ideas or suggestions. Just be aware I’m probably far too green to be able to implement good ones in any reasonable timeframe.

Thanks to everyone on the discord for knowing things, thanks to <#824910699415207937> for being so generally helpful, and thanks to Histidine for indirectly putting me on to just how easy it is to fiddle with .skill files.

```1.0 : Initial release
- Target Analysis, Field Modulation, Bulk Transport, Navigation, Sensors, Hull Restoration changes```
**NOT compatible with any mod that alters the same skills**

RC3:
    
-Added Star Federation stations. 
    -T1 rotates fast, has a deadly combat module, and has separate (but weaker) shields. Plus one ASB (Hellbore).
    -T2 is slower rotating but has massive attack modules that can shunt hard flux. Gets a full ASB compliment.

Rebellion-class Battleship
    -System actually overloads the ship at low flux.
    -Increased DP from 55 to 60.
    -Shield efficiency nerf, 0.8 -> 0.9 flux/damage.

-Fixed Tarrifs, but only in new games. Enjoy not funding healthcare.
-Fixed some more descriptions, thank you Avanita!
-Some more stuff I probs forgotted.```
Don't be afraid to reach out about bugs, or whatever!

items.name: Steelclads
items.summary:
Revival of old Ironclads, with some expansions. Does not match vanilla design styles. Abandoned. Now fixed for 0.95a-RC12
NEXERLIN COMPATIBLE
items.description:
Revival of old Ironclads, with some expansions. Does not match vanilla design styles. Abandoned. 
Now fixed for 0.95a-RC12
NEXERLIN COMPATIBLE - REQUIRED, as well as Magic Lib.


NOTE - Mod is split into parts for ease of mainteinance, and so people with slower connection don't have to download everything again every time. 99% of the time, only the core files will be updated, sometime graphics. Music is unlikely to be touched, the selection is big enough as it is.

INSTALLATION
****************************
Extract the core files first - then get the graphics, fx(weapon sounds) and music files and place them inside
Graphics goes in the graphics folder inside Steelclad mod folder
fx and music go into the sound folder, inside their respective sub-folders.

IF you are getting crashes because of missing files, you most likely have a double folder somewhere ( for example: "Starsector/mods/Steelclads/sounds/sounds/music"   instead of "Starsector/mods/Steelclads/sounds/music")

CHANGELOG
***************
1.0.30:
- fixed Kores and Procyon systems apprearing in wrong place
- fixed Palatine portrait missing
- reverted Manta and Tortoise to being civilian again (AI makes strange fleet compositions)
- Steelclads core files should new create a full folder structure.

1.0.29:
- more balance changes and tweaks
- reflex cannon animation and sound improved (still no perfect)
- added sounds FX download so the entire sounds file wouldn't have to be downloaded every time.
- Manta and Tortoise buffed and made non-civilian

1.0.28:
- ship balance changes (buff in Hull for big ships)
- weapon balance changes (mostly nerfs)
- got the reflex cannon and AIAS shipsystem to work
- a few new weapons
- market fixes for RSF and XLE



KNOWN ISSUES:
- Reflex cannon rife sound loops wrongly.

items.name: Stinger Shipyards
items.summary: A small but growing ship pack adding many ships along with 4 weapond and a new modular fighter wing!
items.description:
Stinger Shipyards aims to fill many combat roles not filled by both vanilla and most other mods. From missile cruisers to drone carrier, you're guaranteed to find something that fits your fleet.

The mod has been reviewed by Moshi, check it out!
[youtube]A9_Jlxw5s-o[/youtube]

If you have any feedback, you can directly message me through discord, turkler#4348. Alternatively, you can find me in the [url=https://discord.gg/EWcH2P8JHv]Starport Corvus[/url] discord!

List of ships, in the order of addition:

[b]* Champion-class (c) Converted Battlecarrier -[/b] A carrier conversion of the baseline Champion hull, this modification gets rid of the large missile mount and two smaller front mounts in exchange of a fighter bay. The ship has been up-armored as well, even thought at the cost of acceleration and strafing speed.

[b]* Lilim-class Missile Destroyer - [/b]The Lilim is a dedicated missile destroyer designed to provide a mobile platform for missile fire support. Being much more sluggish compared to other hulls of its size, the Lilim-class serves a great escort role as the hammer against the anvil. Despite the ship’s great performance as a support platform, it is rarely used in the post-Collapse sector due to the ship’s overbearing maintenance costs.

[b]* Lilith-class Missile Cruiser - [/b]A missile-focused cruiser with a Paladin Point Defense System built-into the hull. Like it's sister ship Lilim, it's impressive firepower is only held back by it's fragile hull and it's overbearing maintenance costs.

[b]* Brynhildr-class Missile Cruiser - [/b]An ancient ship pre-dating even the Onslaught-class battleships we see today, the Brynhildr is an ancient missile cruiser featuring robust construction and no modern shields. Instead, the Brynhildr is equipped with an integrated Damper Field of archaic design but tuned to modern standards. This allows the Brynhildr to shrug off what would otherwise be lethal damage during combat.

[b]* Tartarus-class Missile Frigate -[/b] A favorite of pirates and private armies due to the missile support it can provide along with its non-demanding support profile, the ancient Tartarus-class frigates pack a respectable amount of missile firepower. The ship’s suprising agility allows a wise commander to shift missile support to wherever it is needed.

[b]* Laplace-class Proximity Support Destroyer -[/b] The Laplace is a rare, experimental hull developed by the Tri-Tachyon Corporation in an attempt to weaponize the relatively niche Proximity Charge Launcher. The ship includes a unique Heavy Proximity Charge Launcher built into the hull, along with ordnance assembly facilities that can rearm its unique weapons during extended deployments.

[b]* Adramelech-class Minelayer -[/b] The bigger sister of the Laplace-class, the Adramelech is a rare, experimental hull developed by the Tri-Tachyon Corporation in an attempt to weaponize the relatively weak Proximity Charge Launcher. The ship includes two unique Heavy Proximity Charge Launchers built into the hull, along with ordnance assembly facilities that can rearm its unique weapons during extended deployments. Vast amounts of hull space have been dedicated to the assembly and storage of the built-in phase mine deployment systems, leaving little room for other mounts.

[b]* Morrigan-class Mining Frigate -[/b] The Morrigan is a remarkably simple and reliable dedicated mining frigate. Multiple post-collapse combat upgrades have been installed aboard the nimble frigate, including a particularly exotic one which allows its hardcoded LPC mining drones to overload their reactors and disable range limiters to engage in kamikaze attacks.

[b]* Whiskey Pete-class Mining Auxiliary -[/b] The Whiskey Pete is a drone carrier designed to lead civilian mining operations. Featuring no modular fighter bays, the ship instead includes an array of drones designed to assist in cracking open asteroids which have been modified in cycles post-Collapse to assist during combat situations as well. Nonetheless, the Whiskey Pete is not a combat ship and works bests as a support ship behind the frontlines.

[b]* Perigee-class Destroyer -[/b] The Perigee-class vessel is an effective mix of advanced scientific and military technologies, perfect for long-range exploration of hostile space. The ship features relatively flexible weapon mounts, allowing the ship to fill whatever role is needed in combat engagements. Although the ship excels at support roles it is nonetheless capable at any other role it might be given.

[b]* Mora (DEMIL)-class Auxiliary Platform -[/b] An unmodified original civilian model before the Mora-class hulls were refitted into carriers, demilitarized variants of the Mora-class are still used by salvage crews and prospectors alike.

[b]* Starliner (S)-class Civilian Liner -[/b] An unmodified original civilian model in pristine stock condition, this ship is a collector's item from a more civilized age.

[b]* Jackass-class Combat Freighter  - [/b]An ancient combat superfreighter built to resupply fleets and outpost where combat engagements are expected. Being designed and built before the Colossus series of hulls, the ship lacks the efficiency and cost-effectiveness expected from freighters in the modern realities of the sector. Still, the ship's massive pressurized cargo holds are protected by heavy armor plating and an impressive amount of armaments letting the ship hold its own in combat, making it the ship a solid option for fleets requiring protection against the attention brought from transporting a large volume of cargo.

[spoiler]Although automated machines of war were forbidden in core Domain space, war drones were quietly employed outside of officially incorporated volume. Frontier garrisons were often bolstered by drone ships, and they were deployed liberally against rebellious worlds to tip the terrible balance of attrition, setting the industrial might of the Domain versus the lives of 'freedom fighters'. The Stronghold drone is one of the heaviest drones deployed in drone units. Lacking most regular armament the Stronghold instead includes many missile-type weapon mounts to provide unmatched firepower in the few drone units which were expected to face the heaviest of resistance. Not being much more than a support platform meant that the Stronghold drones were anticipated to regularly be disabled in combat, so the heavy drone was designed with highly modular components which allowed badly damaged hulls to be rapidly cannibalized to repair lightly damaged hulls up to combat capacity without the need for shipyard facilities.[/spoiler]

Along with new hulls, Stinger Shipyards introduces a new modular fighter wing into the sector as well:

[b]* Peridot-class EMP Bomber - [/b]A technologically advanced fighter armed with a single Lapis Lazuli-class EMP torpedo. The payload is enough to knock out most weapon systems and severely cripple shield projectors.

This mod also comes with a handful of new weapons;

[b]* Mephisto CIWS Platform -[/b] A medium-range defensive weapon system that fires at an astonishing rate of a thousand rounds per minute. Standard ship armor is spaced and thus the small rounds fired from the Mephisto are only effective against small targets such as fighters and torpedoes.

[b]* Spica Giga Launcher -[/b] A torpedo launcher designed to fire Giga-class torpedoes in two-round bursts. Makes up for its limited damage potentional with unmatched strike damage.

[b]* Quadruple Giga - [/b]Quad launcher system capable of launching a devastating torpedo barrage. the Quadruple Giga-class torpedo platform offers a devastating four-launch burst of Giga-class torpedoes, but is held back by its hefty logistical profile and a disappointing damage potential during extended deployments due to a limited magazine size.

items.name: Super Degenerate Portrait Pack
items.summary: This is a pack of ~1600 anime-themed portraits from basically every pack I could find for Starsector.
items.description:
[img]https://i.imgur.com/FjXeC1X.png[/img]

[u]What is this?[/u]
1600 anime-style portraits. It's a merger of basically of every anime-themed portrait pack I could find for Starsector merged into one pack, and just a little bit of curation to remove some of the more blatant outliers in quality/size/etc to make the art slightly more consistent.
[u]Why?[/u]
I've been modifying the portrait packs I downloaded to remove outliers in quality and size. Additionally, I've noticed many, perhaps most, mod packs only support vanilla factions and do not include support for most modded factions. I corrected this... but only after a lot of effort in figuring out how. I figured sharing it would save other users a similar struggle. And then I merged them together because I figured it's easier to have one big pack instead of many little ones.
[u]What's in it?[/u]
Contains elements from the following existing packs, with credits to their respective authors:
[list]
[*][url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=12493.0]Degenerate Portrait Pack[/url]
[*][url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=17755.0]Kancolle Portrait Pack[/url]
[*][url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=15939.0]Girls Frontline Portrait Pack[/url]
[*][url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=17251.0]Azur Lane Portrait Packs[/url]
[*][url=https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=17251.msg293022#msg293022]Azur Lane Portraits Expansions[/url]
[*]Discord user Caymon Joestar#6574 GFL Portrait Expansion
[*]Discord user Lolibote#4700's Kancolle Portrait Expansion
[*]Discord user Lolibote#4700's Abyssal Portrait Expansion[/li][li]VNSector Portrait Pack
[/list]
[u]Customization Instructions[/u]
This mod will attempt to add the portraits to [u]every[/u] possible faction, including almost every mod in existence that's been updated to 0.9.1a. You can manually opt out certain factions from the modpack by going to Starsector\mods\Super Degenerate Portrait Pack\data\world\factions directory and deleting the respective faction file. Since deleting a file is far less work than creating one, I opted all factions in by default.

items.name: Sylphon RnD
items.summary: A high tech faction with a pretty purple colour scheme and strange nullspace technology. Designed to fight up close and personal rather than the usual high tech hit-and-run.
items.description:
[b][center]﻿[/center][/b][b][center]﻿[/center][center][size=4]DOWNLOAD UNDER MIRRORS SINCE NEXUS WON'T LET ME UPLOAD[/size]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/DEZURaj.png[/img]﻿
[size=4]Sylphon RnD[/size][/center]

History[/b]

Founded in a long-gone era, the Sylphon Institute for AI research was a small but leading institution in its field of research, making vast strides in the improvement and application of artificial intelligence. Decades of interaction with advanced alpha- and beta-level intelligences soon led to a unique culture within the growing institute as an ever increasing portion of members began accepting AIs as equal lifeforms and partners in their scientific endeavors. To avoid regulation, the institute built a new base of operations at the edge of the Persean Sector, reforming into the Sylphon Research and Development corporation. 

It was only 10 years later that the catastrophic events of the collapse shattered the human Domain and cast the sector into an age of strife. Having only just finished construction of the most essential geofronts deep below the surface of the frozen world of Castrum and still lacking the ability to be self-sufficient, Sylphon entered into a contract with the aspiring Tri-Tachyon corporation, giving them the necessary stability to finish construction of the remaining necessary facilities in exchange for their expertise in AI technology. While this course of action raised many moral concerns within the board of directors, at this point composed of humans and AI equally, it was ultimately deemed necessary for the survival of Sylphon.

Staying under the radar in the following decades, Sylphon achieved self-sufficiency while avoiding political involvement in the chaotic post-collapse years. Having established themselves as a reliable think-tank and technical service provider, the young corporation entered into a multitude of contracts with most of the newly-established sector powers, assisting with anything from logistical planning to major military fleet refits.

Unknown to most, however, was a fortunate discovery by a Sylphon exploratory vessel at the edge of the event horizon of a black hole beyond explored space. An anomaly seemingly never encountered before by mankind, this black rift in space, sprakling with eerie purple lights, opened Nullspace to Sylphon. Bringing with it countless new technological applications, this discovery catapulted the small corporation into a technological renaissance.


[b]Nullspace and Nulltech[/b]

A new pocket-dimension discovered by Sylphon, this dark void seems to be filled with an endless nothingness and not by accident. Governed by a powerful counterforce, Nullspace seeks to eject anything that enters it, be it solid mass or even any form of energy. This counterforce exponentially grows as long as an entity remains within nullspace trying to enter nullspace unprepared would rip even the sturdiest warships apart.

Using a special conduit technology, Sylphon vessels are capable of channeling this counterforce into a temporarily controllable stream of chaotic energies, enabling them to skim or even fully enter nullspace for extended periods of time.

Space within nullspace appears to be uniquely distorted, accelerating all motion within it without affecting the flow of time like p-space.


[b]Features[/b]
- High Tech ships that like to fight up close and personal -
- Unique nulltech-based mobility systems, designed to reposition and flank rather than hit and run -
- A series of armored high tech ships capable of parrying incoming fire to recharge their shields -
- New energy and missile weapons with unique quirks -
- Two new systems on the edge of the sector with more to come -
- The pink planetbuster laser you've always wanted -
- Glorious purple spaceships -


[b]Gameplay hints[/b]
- While a high tech faction, Sylphon ships are for the majority designed to stay in the fight
- The Dread Eagle is a powerful flanker, but its teleport has a long cooldown and can get it in sticky situations
- Sylphon missiles are designed to fill unique roles and aren't a replacement for vanilla missiles
- Nanolaminate Armor ships can use their ship system to "parry" strong incoming fire
- Weapon flux per second displayed in outfitting does not take into account the flux discount from the integrated nullspace conduit hullmod
- With a number of fully automated ships and drone fighters, Sylphon fleet aren't very crew-intensive, but this comes at cost of supply efficiency

items.name: Tahlan Shipworks
items.summary: A ship pack with mostly vanilla-friendly and some more exotic additions for the various existing vanilla factions. Designed for fun first and foremost.
items.description:
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/xmr0Cos.png[/img]

This is a small ship pack mod I've been tinkering away at for a while now and I feel it's in a decent enough state now for a first release on the forums. It adds a couple new ships and weapon of different tech levels and styles, including some new themed content that's going to be expanded upon with more features in the future. The mod is still in its earlier stages and in some parts a bit experimental, but I hope you'll find something to enjoy in my little toybox here.

The ships in this mod have mostly been designed to be fun to fly without breaking the balance of the game (or at least not too much in certain cases).

[b]Recommended Mods:[/b]
[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=16058.0]Vayra's Sector[/url] - Required for custom bounties
[url=https://bit.ly/1wSPmKE]Version Checker[/url]
[url=http://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=10982.0]GraphicsLib[/url]


[b]Features:[/b]
- A decent number of new ships, lovingly handcrafted by me without excessive use of purple paint for once -
- A handful of new fancy weapons in a unique style linked to the Great Houses of Kassadar -
- A set of custom variant skins of vanilla and mod ships related to the same -
- A new pirate subfaction with a unique visual style and as of yet unknown motives -
- Multiple custom bounties for use with Vayra's Sector, adding a number of special unique ship variants -
- Cool new ship systems and fancy synergetic ship designs -
- In the future: Some new campaign features, also linked to the Great Houses and more -[/center]

items.name: The Brighton Federation 0.0.2a: Compat Ed.
items.summary: A federation of refugees fleeing from the atrocities of the Outer Rim, the Brighton Federation is a desperate and small polity. Its population waxes and wanes with each atrocity and each acceptance of refugees from the Core, with only the truly most stubborn fools remaining behind.
items.description:
A federation of refugees fleeing from the atrocities of the Outer Rim, the Brighton Federation is a desperate and small polity. Its population waxes and wanes with each atrocity and each acceptance of refugees from the Core, with only the truly most stubborn fools remaining behind.

Due to their desperate circumstances, and a lack of a proper manufactory, the Federation has been forced to utilise whatever they can lay their hands on to use as ships. Consequently, the Federation uses reconstructed Derelict and Remnant ships, or ships reconstructed from derelicts, as their fleet vessels.

**Forum release, no major change from previous Discord Version**
